title: Open a New Bank Account with DBS/POSB
full_text: Open a New Bank Account with DBS/POSB Open a new account with us anytime, anywhere with digibank using these easy steps. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Are you new to the bank or an existing customer? New Customers You can open your personal My Account and Multiplier Account directly on DBS or POSB digibank mobile. Before you apply, do prepare the required documents using our checklist. Review Document List Note: If additional document or information is required after you submit your application, we will send you a follow up email with the necessary details and instructions. For additional assistance on account opening, simply drop us a note here and our service team will contact you at your preferred date and time. Follow the steps to open a new account with us using digibank mobile. Using Singpass Not Using Singpass Hereâs a tip! Use Singpass to pre-populate information on your application and for instant account opening. 1 Step 1 Download the digibank mobile app from the App Store, Google Play or AppGallery. 2 Step 2 Launch the digibank mobile app and tap on Sign up for digibank. 3 Step 3 Swipe through the introduction screens and tap on I'm New to DBS/POSB. 4 Step 4 Tap Continue with Singpass, login with your Singpass and tap I Agree to retrieve your personal data. If you do not have Singpass, register online. You can refer to the Singpass Instructional Guide. Alternatively, you can tap on Continue without Singpass (see Not Using Singpass tab for the steps) 5 Step 5 Provide all required information in the succeeding screens including your occupation and industry. 6 Step 6 Declare your tax residency status. Select Yes if you are Singapore Tax Resident only. Otherwise, select No and add the country/jurisdiction(s) of your tax residency. Refer to theÂ Rules Governing Tax ResidenceÂ for information on the respective jurisdiction's tax residency rules. 7 Step 7 Tap on the suitable bundle to open an account. 8 Step 8 Complete the questions in the succeeding screens includingÂ Name on card & PIN. 9 Step 9 Upload Supporting Documents and tap Next, if required. Learn more about Documents Required for Account Opening. (Note: After submission, if additional document(s) is required, you will receive an email notification with the necessary instructions.) 10 Step 10 Input your preferred User ID & PIN to create your digibank Credentials. 11 Step 11 Review the details and tap Confirm Application to open your account. If you were required to upload supporting document, your application will be processed within 3 working days after we receive your complete application. Accounts (Click for more info) Application My Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) The first account you can customise to the way you live. Scan the QR code to open a MyAccount on digibank now Open a Joint-Alternate My Account Apply Online Now DBS Multiplier Account (Personal account only) Earn up to 4.1% p.a. on your savings. No minimum salary credit. No minimum credit card spend. Plus, save and transact in SGD and foreign currencies in one account. Scan the QR code to open a Multiplier on digibank now Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! Hereâs a tip! Prepare all supporting documents before starting your application to save time. 1 Step 1 Download the digibank mobile app from the App Store, Google Play or AppGallery. 2 Step 2 Launch the digibank mobile app and tap on Sign up for digibank. 3 Step 3 Swipe through the introduction screens and tap on I'm New to DBS/POSB. 4 Step 4 Tap Continue without Singpass and tap Sign up Manually. 5 Step 5 Provide all required information in the succeeding screens including your occupation and industry. 6 Step 6 Declare your tax residency status. Select Yes if you are Singapore Tax Resident only. Otherwise, select No and add the country/jurisdiction(s) of your tax residency. Refer to theÂ Rules Governing Tax ResidenceÂ for information on the respective jurisdiction's tax residency rules. 7 Step 7 Tap on the suitable bundle to open an account. 8 Step 8 Complete the questions in the succeeding screens includingÂ Name on card & PIN. 9 Step 9 Upload Supporting Documents and tap Next, if required. Learn more about Documents Required for Account Opening. (Note: After submission, if additional document(s) is required, you will receive an email notification with the necessary instructions.) 10 Step 10 Review the details and tap Confirm Application to open your account. Accounts (Click for more info) Application My Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) The first account you can customise to the way you live. Scan the QR code to open a MyAccount on digibank now Open a Joint-Alternate My Account Apply Online Now DBS Multiplier Account (Personal account only) Earn up to 4.1% p.a. on your savings. No minimum salary credit. No minimum credit card spend. Plus, save and transact in SGD and foreign currencies in one account. Scan the QR code to open a Multiplier on digibank now Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! Existing DBS/POSB Customers Follow the steps to open a new personal account with us using digibank. To open Joint account, you may use our online form in My Account and eMySavings pages. digibank mobile digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap More on the bottom navigation bar and under Apply, tap on Deposit Accounts. 3 Step 3 Select an account that you wish to open. Below are the accounts that you can open instantly using digibank mobile. 4 Step 4 Tap on Reference Account for Address to select the account you wish to use as a reference for mailing address. If you wish to link your new account to your existing ATM/Debit card, tap on Link my new account to my exisiting ATM/Debit card and tap on Next. (Note: If you have selected "Link my new account to my exisiting ATM/Debit card", no new card will be issued. You may also link the new account to an existing card at a later time via digibank. Learn more about How to link account to your card.) 5 Step 5 Read through the Important Notes and tap on I Acknowledge. 6 Step 6 Review and confirm your details and tap on Open Account Now to open your account. Accounts (Click for more info) Description My Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) The all-in-one account that offers you freedom and flexibility, while evolving to your changing needs. DBS Multiplier Account (Personal account only) Earn up to 4.1% p.a. on your savings. No minimum salary credit. No minimum credit card spend. eMySavings Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) An automatic monthly savings account with special interest rates - giving you flexibility and control POSB SAYE Account (Personal account only) Enjoy extra 3.5% p.a. interest when you credit your salary and make a monthly saving with us. Fixed Deposit Account (Personal account only) Customise your deposit at a fixed period to maximise your savings. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click on Apply on the left and under Bank, select Deposits.â 4 Step 4 Select the account and click on Apply. 5 Step 5 Read through the information and click Start. 6 Step 6 Check your personal details, select an account your wish to use as the reference address and select Yes or No to choose if you want to link your new account to your existing ATM/ Debit card. Click Next. (Note: If you have selected Yes, no new card will be issued. You may also link the new account to an existing card at a later time via digibank. Learn more about How to link account to your card.) 7 Step 7 Read through the information and click on Yes, I acknowledge to continue. 8 Step 8 Verify your details and click Submit to complete your application. Accounts (Click for more info) Description Application My Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) The all-in-one account that offers you freedom and flexibility, while evolving to your changing needs. Save and transact in SGD and enjoy access to 12 foreign currencies instantly. Apply for Personal Account Apply for Joint-Alternate Account Apply with your Child below 16 years old DBS Multiplier Account (Personal account only) Earn up to 4.1% p.a. on your savings. No minimum salary credit. No minimum credit card spend. Plus, save and transact in SGD and foreign currencies in one account. Apply Now eMySavings Account (Personal and Joint-alternate accounts available) A special savings account that allows you to save monthly in a hassle-free way. Apply for Personal Account Apply for Joint-Alternate Account POSB SAYE Account (Personal account only) Enjoy extra 3.5% p.a. interest when you credit your salary and have successful monthly savings with us. Apply Now Fixed Deposit Account (Personal account only) Customise your deposit at a fixed period to maximise your savings. Apply Now Supplementary Retirement Scheme (Personal account only) Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) lets you save for your retirement and enjoys tax benefits. Apply Now Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions New DBS or POSB Customersâ Who are eligible to open their first account using digibank mobile? Customers who are at least 16 years old and meet any of the following can open their first account directly using DBS digibank mobile: Customers who do not have any product or services with DBS or POSB; or Customers who only have Joint-Trust account with their parents; or Customer who only have Paylah account with DBS. I have just registered for a Singpass account. When can I start using it to register for an account on digibank mobile? Your Singpass/MyInfo profile should be up and ready to use the next day for new account application on your digibank app. What if my mobile number or Registered Address* in Singpass is incorrect or outdated? You may update your details in Singpass before you proceed with your application. Note: *Your new debit card will be mailed to your registered address. I used Singpass to submit application however my account is not instantly opened, why? If you were required to upload supporting document(s), additional processing is required for your application. Your application will be processed within 3 working days upon receiving complete application. I do not have Singpass account, what are the requirements to open an account in digibank mobile? You will need: Valid mobile number, email address and residential address Supporting documents I did not use Singpass to submit my application, what are my next steps?â Your application will be processed within 3 working days after we receive your complete application. Once approved, you will receive your debit card within 3-5 working days then proceed with the following steps: Activate your debit card. Learn more on how to Activate New Card. Once your card is activated, proceed to digibank mobile Registration. Once registered, login in digibank and set up your Digital Token when prompted. Where can I check the status of my account opening application? You may check the status of your application inÂ Application Status Portal. Learn more on how to Check Account Opening Application Status using the portal. Existing DBS or POSB Customers Why am I getting error when I try to open a new account using digibank? For existing DBS or POSB customers, you may open account using digibank if: You have existing valid deposit account with DBS or POSB You have valid contact details and address in the bankâs record You may also try to open account by tapping on Starter Pack menu under Apply in digibank mobile. What is the minimum age to open a personal account? Your child must be at least 16 years old on the date of application. How can my child own a personal account? If your child does not have any account with DBS or POSB or their only account is a Joint Trust account, they may apply for a personal My Account as a new DBS or POSB customer. If your child has other existing account with DBS or POSB and has digibank access, you may refer to the stepsÂ aboveÂ to open a personal account I have a Joint-Alternate My Account with my child. Can my child have digital access to the account Yes, your child must be at least 16 years old on the date of application to apply for digibank. Learn more on digibank mobile Registration. Your child must have: Valid contact details (mobile number and email address) and residential address in the bankâs record. Learn more on how to updateÂ mobile numberÂ andÂ email address. Activated ATM, Debit, or Credit Card, or his own Singpass account (for Singaporean and Permanent Residents only) Can I convert the Joint-Alternate My Account for Kids to a personal account for my child? Joint-Alternate My Account for Kids cannot be converted to a personal account. However, your child can apply for a personal account via digibank online or digibank mobile app once they reach 16 years old. More information Once your account is opened, you will be notified via email. Your debit card will be mailed to your registered address within 3 working days. Documents Required for Account Opening Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Documents Required for Account Opening
full_text: Documents Required for Account Opening Simply upload photos or scanned copies of the required documents if youâre applying online for a Personal or Joint-Alternate Account. â Refer on the document submission guidelines for tips on submitting acceptable documents. After submitting your application, you may visit My Application Portal and log on with your credentials to check on your application status. List of required and acceptable documents Other documents not listed below may be required to process your application. You will receive a follow up email with the necessary details, if applicable.â Singaporean/ Permanent Resident SGPR Using Singpass SGPR Not using Singpass Proof of Residential Address (if address used differs from Myinfo) SGPR Singpass Provide any one of the following documents that shows your current residential addressâ Front and back of NRIC or Local utility bill or Telecommunication bill or Local bank / credit card statement Name and address should match that on your application form. Document must be dated within 3 months before the date of application. Note: Residential address must be valid. (P.O. Box, Care-of, Office and School address are not acceptable)â Tenancy agreement is not acceptable proof of residential address. Singapore NRICâ Utility bill/ Telco Bill Bank statement Proof of Tax Residency (if declared tax residency is not Singapore) SGPR Singpass Provide any one of the following documents for each country/jurisdiction of tax residency declaredâ Passport or National identity card or Others (residence permit/work pass/student pass/birth cert/ government-issued documents from tax authority showing recent filing of income tax) Name on document should match that on your application form.â Document must be dated within 3 months before the date of application. National Identity Card Passport biodata page Proof of Mobile ownership (optional, only if registered mobile is a recycled number) SGPR Singpass Provide a copy of either Telco bill or Telco confirmation letter* Name on document should match that on your application form.â Document must be dated within 3 months before the date of application.â Signatures and authority stamps should be captured clearly, if applicable. Note: If the Telco bill is not under your name, proof of relationship between you and telco bill owner might be required.â *Telco confirmation letter can be obtained from your telco provider (Singtel, Starhub, M1, etc).â Telco bill Telco confirmation letter Identity Card SGPR Not Singpass Provide a copy of either Front and back of NRIC or Valid Re-entry Permit and Passport (For Singapore Permanent Resident). Identity Card No. and personal details should match that on your application form. To ensure the security of your account, verification of your NRIC at one of our branches is required. Identity Card Re-entry permit Proof of Residential Address SGPR Not Singpass Provide any one of the following documents that shows your current residential addressâ Front and back of NRIC or Local utility bill or Telecommunication bill or Local bank / credit card statement. Submit documents that match your application form Tip: Ensure that your document is valid. Review details (e.g. expiry dates, visibility of details) before you submit your application. 2. Avoid blurring/blocking document details Tip: Use natural light (instead of flash mode on your camera) or position your document where reflection does not blur any part of the image. 3. Prevent details of documents from being cropped out Tip: Frame your image by leaving at least 1 cm gap on each side of the document when you photograph it digitally. 4. Submit complete identity document Tip: Capture both the profile picture and all printed details. Do not block or crop out any of the details. 5. Submit images that are in focus Tip: When using mobile phone, tap the screen to correct the camera’s focus before taking the picture. 6. Avoid skewed distortions of your image Tip: Ensure your phone is parallel to your document when taking the picture. Try placing your document against a white piece of paper and use it as a parallel frame. Follow up application If you receive an email request to provide additional supporting documents, log on to Application Status Portal to upload the additional requested documents. Personal & Joint-Alternate Account 1 Step 1 Log on to Application Status Portal. 2 Step 2 Choose your Identification type, and enter your NRIC/ Malaysian IC/ Passport number and Email address used in your application. 3 Step 3 Enter the 6 digit Email OTP sent to your email address used in the application. 4 Step 4 Under Recently submitted applications, find the application and tap on Upload documents. 5 Step 5 Enter the 6 digit SMS OTP sent to your mobile number used in the application. 6 Step 6 Upload all required documents and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Your document(s) are successfully uploaded. Tap Done to return to main page. Applying for a Singpass account? Here's how.â Pro tip: Select Face Verification for instant registration.â For foreigners: Have your FIN number and Singapore (+65) mobile number ready.â Important: Your Singpass should be ready to use once your Personal details are displayed in your Singpass mobile app. Once your Singpass is set up, you can sign up for a digbank account. sections.heading: Documents Required for Account Opening
sections.content: Simply upload photos or scanned copies of the required documents if youâre applying online for a Personal or Joint-Alternate Account. â Refer on the document submission guidelines for tips on submitting acceptable documents. After submitting your application, you may visit My Application Portal and log on with your credentials to check on your application status.

Personal & Joint-Alternate Account 1 Step 1 Log on to Application Status Portal. 2 Step 2 Choose your Identification type, and enter your NRIC/ Malaysian IC/ Passport number and Email address used in your application. 3 Step 3 Enter the 6 digit Email OTP sent to your email address used in the application. 4 Step 4 Under Recently submitted applications, find the application and tap on Upload documents. 5 Step 5 Enter the 6 digit SMS OTP sent to your mobile number used in the application. 6 Step 6 Upload all required documents and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Your document(s) are successfully uploaded. sections.heading: Applying for a Singpass account?
sections.content: Here's Pro tip: Select Face Verification for instant registration.â Have your FIN number and Singapore (+65) mobile number ready.â Learn more

sections.heading: More information
sections.content: If you are a new DBS / POSB customer, you can open your personal My Account and Multiplier Account via the digibank mobile app. For further assistance, simply drop us a note and our service team will contact you at your preferred date and time. *Residential Address: A non-commercial address where the customer resides. An overseas residential address can used to apply for an account if a Singapore address is unavailable at that point. Letter issued by government of other public bodies regulated for AML practices or a letter from regulated insurance companies in a FATF member country may be uploaded as proof. However, customers are required to update to Singapore address via digibank once available. For Online Personal or Joint-Alternate Account Application, please ensure that the proof of residential address uploaded for each applicant indicates their address and issue date clearly. For Joint-Alternate account application, both applicantâs proof of addresses are required. For proof of mobile number ownership (if applicable), please upload either a local telecommunication bill/confirmation letter or mobile service agreement (signed acceptance page).

For Joint-Alternate account application, both applicantâs proof of addresses are required. title: DBS Account Opening Application Status Check
full_text: Check Account Opening Application Status New to the bank and applied for a personal account via the digibank mobile app recently? Learn how to check the status or follow up on your application. How to Check Account Opening Application Status 1 Step 1 Log on to Application Status Portal. 2 Step 2 Choose your Identification type, and enter your NRIC/ Malaysian IC/ Passport number and Email address used in your application. 3 Step 3 Enter the 6 digit Email OTP sent to your email address used in the application. 4 Step 4 You can check your application status under Recently submitted applications. 5 Step 5 Tap on Completed applications to view your processed application(s). 6 Step 6 If your application is successful, you may tap on Authenticate via SMS to view account number. How to follow up on applications? 1 Step 1 Log on to Application Status Portal. 2 Step 2 Choose your Identification type, and enter your NRIC/ Malaysian IC/ Passport number and Email address used in your application. 3 Step 3 Enter the 6 digit Email OTP sent to your email address used in the application. 4 Step 4 Under Recently submitted applications, find the application and tap on Upload documents. 5 Step 5 Enter the 6 digit SMS OTP sent to your mobile number used in the application. 6 Step 6 Upload all required documents and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Your document(s) are successfully uploaded. Tap Done to return to main page. More information You will receive an email update about your application status after we proceed to open your account.â This service is available to you ifâ: You do not have an existing banking relationship with us. You applied for a personal account via digibank app. Frequently Asked Questions I am having trouble logging in, it says that I donât have any applications after I entered my details. Please check to ensure that you are using the same NRIC/Malaysian IC/Passport and email used in the application. â What is the file size / file type that I can upload?â We accept JPG, PNG, PDF and TIF, up to 5MB in file size. Please compress your file size if it is too big.â Iâm having trouble uploading my documents.ââ If you are still facing issues uploading documents after multiple tries (with different documents), please try again at a later time.â My application is still in processing status after a few days.ââ We strive to process your applications by the time stipulated in the portal. Sometimes this may take longer if you have just submitted a follow-up document.â Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Activate Account (New to Bank Customers)
full_text: Activate Account (New to Bank Customers) Activate your Savings Account immediately via digibank or a DBS/POSB ATM. To activate your Current Account simply visit any DBS/POSB Branch with your NRIC/Passport. How to activate account (New to Bank Customers) Savings Account Activation Upon successful application of your New Savings Account. You will receive a Debit Card and PIN within 5 working days. Follow our guide to activate your new debit card via digibank mobile, digibank digibank online or via a DBS/POSB ATM. Your Savings Account will be activated concurrently with your Debit Card activation. Current Account Activation (DBS eMulti-Currency Autosave Plus) Upon successful application of your DBS eMulti-Currency Autosave Plus. Visit any DBS/POSB Branch with your NRIC/Passport to activate your account and the chequebook will be mailed to you registered mailing address with the bank. Was this information useful? title: Change MySavings/SAYE Account Instruction
full_text: Change MySavings/SAYE Account Instruction Amend the monthly savings arrangement of your personal or joint-alternate MySavings or SAYE Account via digibank online. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank online Important information Ensure that you have enough funds in your debiting account by 7pm, one day before the debiting date. Fund Transfer/GIRO/SI directly to MySavings Account are not considered as successful contribution. Upon the first failed deduction of the monthly savings amount, a reminder letter will be generated the next calendar day to be mailed to your mailing address. This also serves as a closure notice as the MSA/SAYE will be automatically closed by the Bank if there are 3 consecutive failed deductions. Upon auto-closure by the Bank, the funds in the MSA/SAYE will be auto credited to your debiting account by the 2nd day of the month. How to change MySavings/SAYE account instruction digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, and select your MySaving/ POSB SAYE account. 4 Step 4 Click on Manage at the top and under More select Savings Instructions. 5 Step 5 Enter the details and click Next. Monthly savings: Enter a Monthly Savings Amount in multiples of SGD10. From: Account you wish to make contribution from. Monthly Savings Date: Select the monthly savings date for your contribution. You can only choose between 1st to 25th of the month. 6 Step 6 Verify your details and click Confirm to change your saving instructions. 7 Step 7 Your new saving instructions is submitted successfully. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information It takes 2 working days for us to process the change of your monthly savings arrangement. If your new monthly savings date is within the next 2 days of your request, the changes will only take effect next month. If your monthly savings amount is debited from a 3rd party account, visit any branch with the 3rd party account holder to amend the arrangement. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Check Account Balance View your eStatements and eAdvices Close a DBS/POSB Deposit Account Related articles Check Account Balance View your eStatements and eAdvices Close a DBS/POSB Deposit Account

title: Check and Share Account Transaction Details
full_text: Check and Share Account Transaction Details You can check your transactions using digibank, DBS digibot and Phone Banking. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank online Important information You can view your eStatements and eAdvices for transactions that are more than 6 months ago. For PayLah! transactions, log in via DBS PayLah! app. Learn more on how to check PayLah! transaction history. How to check and share your account transaction details There are various channels which you may check your account transactions with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to your digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home, tap on Deposits and select the Account you wish to view. 3 Step 3 Scroll down to view your transaction history. You may view up to past 6 months of transaction history including pending/declined transactions under the Pending/ Declined tab. 4 Step 4 Tap to view more details of your transactions. 5 Step 5 Your transaction details will be displayed. If you wish to share your transaction details, tap on the Download icon at the top right. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits and select the Account you wish to view. 4 Step 4 Scroll down to view your transaction history. You may view up to past 6 months of transaction history including pending/declined transactions under the Pending/ Declined tab. Click on the transaction to view more details. 5 Step 5 Your transaction details will be displayed. If you wish to share your transaction details, click on the Download icon at the top right. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS digibot Click on the steps to view screens 1 Step 1 Click on the digibot Icon located at the bottom right. 2 Step 2 Type Check and Share Account Transaction Details into the chat. 3 Step 3 Click Authenticate me. 4 Step 4 Complete the authentication using either your iBanking Login or Card & PIN. 5 Step 5 Select your Account and the Type of Transaction that you wish to enquire on. 6 Step 6 Your selected account transaction history for the last 2 months will be shown. Launch our DBS digibot now! Get Started Phone Banking Dial 1800 111 1111 (from Singapore) or (65) 6327 2265 (from Overseas) for DBS Personal Banking Hotline (24/7). For a menu in English Press 1, for Mandarin Press 2. Enter your NRIC, Debit or Credit Card Number followed by # to proceed. Follow the steps for SMS OTP to proceed. Select Deposit Account Related Services. Press 1 for Account Balance(s). Press 2 for Last 5 Transactions. Enter your Account Number OR; Press # to list all the Accounts. Frequently Asked Questions Why is the amount debited from my account higher than the transaction amount I made through the merchant website / mobile app? If your card transaction is converted to Singapore dollars via dynamic currency conversion (a service offered at certain overseas merchants or websites), you will be subject to an administrative fee on the converted Singapore dollar amount, which shall be payable by you and debited from your Card account. This includes but is not limited to any card transaction in Singapore dollars on overseas-based websites and mobile applications. Learn more about overseas card transaction fees. I spotted an unauthorised transaction in my account. What should I do? Log in to digibank mobile to check the transaction. If the transaction is not made by you, go to Payment Controls on the digibank mobile app, and lock the card. Follow our step-by-step guide on how to lock your card temporarily. Call DBS Fraud Reporting hotline 1800 339 6963 or (65) 6339 6963 from overseas. DBS will investigate, and we will credit the disputed amount within 7 working days for successful cases. Should further verification be required, we will reach out to you within 7 working days. Learn more about how to submit your card transaction dispute. Merchant charged me multiple times. What should I do? We advise you to contact the merchant to seek clarifications first. If you cannot resolve the matter, you can get in touch with us to raise a chargeback request with the merchant. Not what you looking for? Try searching for more information Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles DBS/POSB Transaction Codes & Descriptions Check Account Balance Check Remit Staus Made a funds transfer to a wrong recipient? Resolve Unexpected Transactions Related articles DBS/POSB Transaction Codes & Descriptions Check Account Balance Check Remit Staus Made a funds transfer to a wrong recipient? Resolve Unexpected Transactions

title: Check Account Balance
full_text: Check Account Balance You can check your account balance using DBS Digibot, digibank (setup Peek Balance via digibank mobile to skip login), Phone banking or at DBS/POSB ATM. Part of: Guides > Go Travel with DBS, Go Shopping with DBS How to check account balance There are various channels which you may check account balance with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile Click on the steps to view screens 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Your Account Balance will be display on the homepage. 3 Step 3 You can activate Peek Balance option by tapping More and under App & Security Settings, select Peek Balance. 4 Step 4 Toggle the Switch to Activate and select the Account for Peek Balance, tap Save. 5 Step 5 You may Tap and hold to Peek Balance on your preferred account without log in to digibank mobile. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, your account balance will be displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS Digibot Click on the steps to view screens 1 Step 1 Click on located at the bottom right. 2 Step 2 Type Account Balance into the chat. 3 Step 3 Click Authenticate me to complete the authentication using either your iBanking Login or Card & PIN. 4 Step 4 Select your Account that you wish to view and Choose the type of balance you wish to enquire on. 5 Step 5 If you select Available and Ledger Balance, Amount on hold, your account balance will be shown. 6 Step 6 If you select Hold Balance (for cheques), your holding balance for cheque(s) deposited will be shown. Launch our DBS Digibot now! Get Started Phone Banking Dial 1800 111 1111 (from Singapore) or (+65) 6327 2265 (from Overseas). For a menu in English Press 1, for Mandarin Press 2. Enter your NRIC, Debit or Credit Card Number followed by # to proceed. Follow the steps for SMS OTP to proceed. Select Deposit Account Related Services. Press 1 to listen to your Account Balance(s). DBS/POSB ATM Insert your ATM/Debit/Credit Card and key in your PIN. Select Balance Inquiry. Select your Account Type. Your Account Balance will be reflected. Select End and remove ATM card. Find the nearest ATM using our Locator. Differences in Total and Available Balance Total balance is the total amount of money in your account, comprising of available balance (usable funds) & earmarked/holding balance (non-usable funds). Usable funds Available Balance: Available balance refers to the balance in your account available for spending, withdrawal or transfers. Non-usable funds Earmarked Amounts: Earmarked amounts are funds set aside, possibly due to Debit Card spending and/or promotional Fixed Deposits that you may have signed up for. Holding Balance: Holding balance indicates that a cheque deposit have been made into your account and is currently being processed for clearance. One-Day Holding Balance: Cheque has been collected and is being processed. Funds will be available within 1 business day if cheque is successfully cleared. Half-Day Holding Balance: Cheque has been processed and funds will be available after 2:00 pm on a business day if cheque is successfully cleared. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Deposit Account Minimum Balance Service Charge
full_text: Deposit Account Minimum Balance Service Charge Your deposit account will incur this service charge when your balance falls below the minimum average daily balance. Important information To avoid incurring the Service Charge, ensure that your account meets the Minimum Average Daily Balance. Your Average Daily Balance is the total amount of your account balances at the end of each day, divided by the number of days in the month. Example Letâs take the month of June as an example, which has 30 days. First 15 days: Your account had $100 every day→ $100 Ã 15 days = $1,500 Next 15 days: Your account had $400 every day→ $400 Ã 15 days = $6,000 Total of daily balances: $1,500 + $6,000 = $7,500 Average Daily Balance: $7,500 Ã· 30 days = $250 Refer to the table below to find the minimum average daily balance required for your specific account type. DBS Account Account Type Minimum Average Daily Balance (MADB) Service Charge DBS My Account S$0 S$2.00 per month (for customers on hardcopy statement) DBS Savings Account(Opened before 12 September 2011) S$500 S$2.00 per month DBS Savings Account(Opened from 12 September 2011) S$1,000 S$2.00 per month DBS Multiplier Account* S$3,000 S$5.00 per month DBS eMulti-Currency Autosave Account* DBS Multi-Currency/eMulti-Currency Autosave Plus Account* DBS eAutosave Account DBS eAutosave Plus Account DBS Current Account S$3,000 S$7.50 per month DBS Expatriate eMulti-Currency Autosave Account* DBS Expatriate eMulti-Currency Autosave Plus Account* DBS Expatriate Autosave Account DBS Expatriate eAutosave Plus Account S$5,000 S$7.50 per month *Total SGD$ equivalent Minimum Average Daily Balance (MADB) across all currency wallets. POSB Account Account Type Minimum Average Daily Balance (MADB) Service Charge POSB eSavings Account POSB Everyday/eEveryday Savings Account POSB Passbook Savings Account S$500 S$2.00 per month POSB Current/eCurrent Account S$1,500(Maintained in linked POSB Savings Account) S$2.00 per month Effective 16 June 2019, POSB Savings - SPEP Account and POSB Savings - AF have been renamed as POSB Everyday Savings Account. DBS Treasures DBS Treasures Month End Balance Service Charge DBS Treasures Membership* *Assets included for AUM computation to count towards month-end balance includes: Treasures clientâs Deposits Investments and Insurance (Single Premium Only) based on Treasures membership Assets held under Wealth Management Account (WMA) where applicable Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) S$200,000 in Deposits &/or Investments S$50 per month charged quarterly The service fee is calculated on a monthly basis, debited every quarter of the year. The debiting months are January, April, July and October. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Check Account Transaction Check Account Balance Related articles Check Account Transaction Check Account Balance

title: View Joint Account Information
full_text: View Joint Account Information View the details of your joint account holder via digibank mobile. How to view your joint account holder names There are various channels which you may link Savings/Current account to your card with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home, tap on Deposits and select the account that you wish to view. 3 Step 3 Under your account profile, select Settings. 4 Step 4 Your Joint Account Holder details will be displayed. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Deposits, select the Account you wish to view. 4 Step 4 Click on Manage at the top and under Account Information your Joint Account Holder details will be displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Convert POSB Passbook Savings Account
full_text: Convert POSB Passbook Savings Account Convert your existing POSB Passbook Savings Account into a POSB Everyday Savings Account without a change in your account number and services. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank How to convert POSB Passbook Savings account digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits and select your POSB Passbook Saving account.â 4 Step 4 Click Manage at the top and under More, select Convert your account type on the right. 5 Step 5 Click Next to proceed with your POSB Passbook conversion. 6 Step 6 Verify your details and click Confirm to complete the conversion request.â Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information Upon successful conversion, you will no longer be able to update your Passbook; you will instead receive monthly eStatements for the transactions on your POSB Everyday Savings Account. If you do not currently have a debit card, you will receive a DBS Visa Debit Card upon conversion. Was this information useful? title: Request for DBS Account Conversion
full_text: Request for DBS Account Conversion Convert your existing DBS eAutoSave/eMulti-Currency Account to a My Account or a DBS Multiplier Account without a change in your account number and services. How to request for DBS account conversion digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, and select your DBS eAutoSave/eMulti-Currency Account. 4 Step 4 Click on Manage at the top and under Options, select Convert. 5 Step 5 Select the type of account you wish to convert to and click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify the details and click Confirm to complete conversion request. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information All transaction details will be available in your monthly statement. SMS notification will be sent, upon successful conversion of your account. You will receive monthly Statements for the transactions on your My Account after the conversion. If you are currently receiving eStatements, you will continue to receive them. For more information, click My Account to learn more. DBS Multiplier Account is a multi-currency account with eStatement and with no checking facility. By converting to DBS Multiplier Account, you will be automatically enrolled for eStatement. The checking facility of the Selected Account, if any, will be discontinued with immediate effect. Upon successful conversion, the fees and charges of DBS Multiplier Account will apply immediately. A fee of S$5 will be charged if average daily balance falls below S$3,000 (based on total SGD equivalent of SGD & foreign currency balances). For more information,click DBS Multiplier Account to learn more. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Close a Current/Savings Account
full_text: Close a Current/Savings Account Close your Current/Savings Account via digibank online. Important information Account closure is permanent, and cannot be reinstated. Eligible accounts can be closed via this service include all Current/Savings Account, MySavings Account/ SAYE/ eSavings Account. This service is only available on digibank online (website). It cannot be done on your mobile app. Any DBS/POSB account linked to Paylah! cannot be closed. Learn more on how to Update DBS PayLah! Linked Account. How to close a personal or joint alternate account There are various channels which you may close a personal or joint alternate account with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank online. digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Deposits, select the Account you wish to close. 4 Step 4 Select Manage at the top and under Close this account, click on Close. 5 Step 5 Select an Account for the balance to be transferred to and click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify the details and click Confirm to close your account. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions How can I make sure my account balance is zero before closing it if it's negative, below $1, or holding/earmarked any funds? When you close your account, you will have the option to transfer any remaining balance to another account you hold with us. If you wish to transfer your remaining balance to an overseas account, another local bank, or if you don't have another DBS/POSB account, simply use DBS remit, overseas transfer, or local funds transfer option in digibank before submitting your account closure request. If the balance is negative or below $1, top up to at least $1 and transfer the money out of your account before closing the account. For holding/earmarked balance, wait for a few days until the transactions are settled and ensure your available balance is zero before closing the account. What happens to the payment facilities linked to my closed account? All your ATM/Debit Cards and GIRO facilities linked to the closed account will be terminated upon account closure Will I be able to retrieve my transactions that have not been posted to my account upon account closure? Any transactions that may not have been posted to your account upon closure will not be retrievable or provided via statements. Can I request for a mail-in form to close my account? We no longer accept account closure requests by mail. Refer to our step by step guide above to close your account online. Why is my account unavailable for account closure online according to the step-by-step guide above? Only Personal or Joint Alternate Account can be closed online. The accounts listed below are not eligible for online account closure. Please visit a DBS/POSB branch to close the accounts. Joint-All Account (both account holders are required to be present at a DBS/POSB branch) Deceased / Estate Account CDA / Trust Account Last Account with the bank Loan Servicing Account Cashline Account / Fixed Deposit Account / Cheque Book Account / CPF Investment Account / DBS IDEAL Account / Standing Instruction Account / DBS Investment Account How do I close an account for a deceased person? You may refer to this page for more information. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Cancel Credit, Debit or ATM Card Close DBS PayLah! title: Local Cash Withdrawal
full_text: Local Cash Withdrawal Withdraw cash locally from our islandwide network of Self-Service Banking Machines or using POSB Cashpoint. How to do a Local Cash Withdrawal There are various channels which you may do a local cash withdrawal with us. The most convenient method would be via Self-Service Banking Machines or using POSB Cashpoint.You will need an active ATM/Debit/Credit card to make a withdrawal. Cash Withdrawal Service Locate a Cash Withdrawal Service near you: Insert your ATM/Debit/Credit Card. Key in your 6-Digit Card PIN. Withdraw from your Primary Account Withdraw from Other Account(s) Choose a Preset Withdrawal Amount from the Fast Cash List. OR Select Choose Another Amount to enter an amount you wish to withdraw. Collect your ATM/Debit/Credit Card and Cash. Select Cash Withdrawal from the Services List. Select the Account you wish to withdraw from. Enter the Amount you wish to withdraw and press Confirm. Collect your ATM/Debit/Credit Card and Cash. More information Withdrawal Denominations - S$10 and S$50 notes at all machines. S$2, S$5, S$10, S$50, S$100 notes at selected machines. Refer here for more information. All withdrawals are subjected to daily card limit and machine availability. You may Update your Card Limit via digibank. The total amount of cash that you can withdraw per day at both local and overseas ATMs is capped. This daily cash withdrawal limit applies regardless of the number of cards you have. Click here for details. POSB Cash-Point Locate a POSB Cash-Point and withdraw up to S$200 with any purchase at our participating merchants islandwide* Make a purchase at our participating outlets*. Use your DBS/POSB ATM/Debit/Credit Card (linked to a deposit account) to make a Nets payment. Indicate the Amount you wish to withdraw. Key in your 6-Digit Card PIN. Collect your DBS/POSB ATM/Debit/Credit Card, Cash and purchases. More information *Participating outlets: Giant / Cold Storage / Market Place / Jasons / 7-Eleven / Guardian Health & Beauty / Buzz. All cash withdrawals will be deducted from the card's NETS Limit. Cash Withdrawal are in multiples of S$10, subjected to individual merchant outlet's cash availability and withdrawal limits. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Change ATM Card Limit Deposit Cash Related articles Change ATM Card Limit Deposit Cash

title: Deposit Cash
full_text: Deposit Cash Deposit cash into a DBS/POSB Account easily via our Self-Service Banking Machines available islandwide. How to Deposit Cash Locate a Cash Deposit Service near you: Filter âCash Depositâ (for ATM+) or âBTMâ to check the locations Cash deposit with a DBS/POSB Card To your personal account To other account Insert your ATM/ Debit/ Credit Card. Key in your 6-Digit Card PIN. Select Cash Deposit. Select the Account that is tagged to your card. Place your cash into the cash slot and select Next. Verify the total deposited amount and select Confirm. Collect your ATM/Debit/Credit Card and Receipt. Insert your ATM/ Debit/ Credit Card. Key in your 6-Digit Card PIN. Select Cash Deposit. Select Other DBS/POSB Account. Select the Account Type. Enter the Account Number and select Confirm. Verify the selected account type and number and select Next. Place your cash into the cash slot and select Next. Verify the total deposited amount and select Confirm. Collect your ATM/Debit/Credit Card and Receipt. Cash deposit without a DBS/POSB Card Touch the Screen and select Cash Deposit. Select the Account Type. Enter the Account Number and select Confirm. Verify the selected account type and number and select Next. Enter your NRIC/Passport Number and select Confirm. Enter your Mobile Number and select Confirm. Place your cash into the cash slot and select Next. Verify the total deposited amount and select Confirm. Collect your Receipt. Note For cardless deposits, do not exceed S$20,000 per cash deposit transaction (subject to notes condition and account limit of $50,000 per day). Cash deposit with a Passbook Flip your Passbook to the last printed page and insert to the machine. Select Cash Deposit. Place your cash into the cash slot and select Next. Verify the total deposited amount and select Confirm. Collect your Passbook and Receipt. More information Notes Accepted: ATM+: S$10, S$50, S$100, S$1,000 denominations Branch Teller Machine (BTM and BTM+): S$2, S$5, S$10, S$50, S$100, S$1,000 denominations You can deposit a maximum of 200 pieces per cash deposit transaction. Do not deposit any commemorative notes. E.g. Bicentennial Notes. Was this information useful? title: Deposit Coins| DBS Singapore
full_text: Deposit Coins Deposit coins into a DBS/POSB Account easily via our Coin Deposit Machines available islandwide. Important information Deposit coins into a DBS/POSB Account instantly via our upgraded Coin Deposit Machines or; At any DBS/POSB Branches on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 8.30 am to 11.30 am only. How to deposit coins There are various channels which you may Deposit Coins with us. The most convenient method would be via Coin Deposit Machine. Coin Deposit Machine Find the nearest Coin Deposit Machine using our Locator. Coin deposit fees are WAIVED when using the Coin Deposit Machine. Branch Find the nearest Branch using our Locator. Coin deposit fees is at S$1.80 per 100 pieces or part thereof. e.g. 105 pieces = S$3.60 Coins are to be sorted in its respective denominations before presenting to the counter staff for depositing. No waiver for MyAccount, POSBkids and POSB Child Development Account (until the child turns 16 years old) coin deposit done Over-The-Counter. More information Accepted denominations: 1 cent, 5 cent, 10 cent, 20 cent, 50 cent & 1 dollar (Singapore Coins - Floral Series & National Icon/Landmark Series). title: Exchange Foreign Currencies using DBS Multi-Currency Account
full_text: Exchange Foreign Currencies using DBS Multi-Currency Account Buy and exchange foreign currencies at your preferred rates wherever you are, using DBS Multi-Currency Account Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information Foreign currency transactions between Retail Banking accounts are available 24 hours daily; except till 2000hrs on the last working day of the month. Foreign currency transactions between Wealth investment accounts and Retail Banking accounts are available 24 hours from Mondays to Saturdays; except till 2000hrs on the last working day of the month. How to exchange foreign currencies using DBS Multi-Currency Account There are various channels which you may exchange foreign currencies using DBS Multi-Currency Account with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap Pay & Transfer at the bottom and select Exchange Currency. 3 Step 3 Select your debiting account, the recipient account and currency and enter the Amount to be convert. (You may View Exchange Rates to view the indicative foreign exchange rates before performing the transfer.) 4 Step 4 Verify your currency exchange details and tap Transfer now. 5 Step 5 You've successfully exchange currency on your account. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits and select the Multi-Currency Account you wish to exchange currencies from. 4 Step 4 Under Overview, click on Exchange currency on the right and click Next. 5 Step 5 Enter the amount to be converted and select the currency you wish to exchange accordingly. Click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify your currency exchange details and click Transfer now. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! title: Authentication in Phone Banking
full_text: Authentication in Phone Banking SMS OTP is an easy way to verify your identity without having to remember any additional PIN or Password. Important information Ensure you have updated your mobile number. How to complete Authentication in Phone Banking Dial 1800 111 1111 (from Singapore) or (+65) 6327 2265 (from Overseas). For a menu in English Press 1, for Mandarin Press 2. Enter your NRIC, Debit or Credit Card Number. Youâll automatically be offered to be authenticated by SMS OTP on your registered mobile number. Key in the 6-digit one-time password that you have received within 100 seconds. You have completed authentication and may now proceed with your request over the phone. Frequently Asked Questions What is SMS OTP? AnÂ SMS OTPÂ (one-time password) is a secure authorization method where a numeric code is sent to a mobile number via SMS. How to apply for SMS OTP? As long as you are a DBS/POSB customer with a registered mobile number, you are automatically eligible. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! title: Apply for a Debit Card
full_text: Apply for a Debit Card Apply for a Debit Card via digibank or get it instantly at our Video Teller Machine (VTM). Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Online How to apply for a Debit Card There are various channels which you may apply for a Debit Card with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More on the bottom navigation bar and under Apply, tap on Cards. 3 Step 3 Tap on Debit Card. 4 Step 4 Tap on the Debit Card that you wish to apply for. 5 Step 5 Under Link an account for your new card, select your Account to be linked to the card and enter the Name to appear on the card. Enter Promo code (if any) and tap Next. 6 Step 6 Review your application details and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Create a PIN for your new card and click Submit to complete your Debit Card application. Your new Debit Card will be mailed to your address within 3-5 working days after your application has been approved. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click on Apply on the left and under Cards, select Debit Cards.â 4 Step 4 Select the debit card and click on Apply now. 5 Step 5 Under Link an account for your new card, select your Account to be linked to the card and enter the Name to appear on the card. Enter Promo code (if any) and click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify your application details and click Next. 7 Step 7 Create a new PIN for your new card and click Submit to complete your application. Your new Debit Card will be mailed to your address within 3-5 working days after your application has been approved. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Video Teller Machine (VTM) Insert any of your existing ATM/Debit/Credit Card and key in your card pin. Under Card Services, select Apply Debit Card. Choose the Debit Card you wish to apply and select the Accounts to be linked to the card. Indicate the Limit you wish to set and confirm the Name to be printed on your New Debit Card. Confirm your New Card PIN and agree to the Terms and Conditions. Get a One Time Password via SMS and key it into the Video Teller Machine (VTM). Collect Both your new and old Debit Card before you leave the machine. Note Instant card application for PAssion POSB Debit Card and DBS VISA Debit Card. If you do not have any existing ATM/Debit/Credit Card, you may scan your NRIC or Passport between 9am to 6pm daily to be connected to our VSOs. List of Debit Cards Debit Cards(Click for more info) Application DBS Takashimaya Debit Card Apply now DBS UnionPay Platinum Debit Card Apply now DBS Visa Debit Card Apply now PAssion POSB Debit Card Apply now SAFRA DBS Debit Card Apply now More information For PAssion POSB Debit Card application, you are required to input your details for your PAssion Membership. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! title: Activate New Card
full_text: Activate New Card You can activate your new card easily using digibank or at our DBS/POSB ATM. Important information For customers without digibank access, you may visit go.dbs.com/sg-webact to activate your new card. Supplementary cards need to be activated independently from main cards, and can be activated even before the main card is activated. Upon card activation, you may reset your card pin instantly via digibank. For activation of Business Advance Card, activate your card via Online Activation, DBS IDEAL or complete the activation slip and mail it to the address indicated on the form. How to activate new card There are various channels which you may activate a new card with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile Credit Cards ATM/Debit Card 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More tab. 3 Step 3 Under Manage Cards & Loans, tap Activate Cards. 4 Step 4 Tap Activate Credit Card. 5 Step 5 Tap on the Credit Card you would like to activate. 6 Step 6 Review your request and tap Activate Card to complete your card activation request. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More tab. 3 Step 3 Under Manage Cards & Loans, tap Activate Cards. 4 Step 4 Tap Activate ATM/Debit Card. 5 Step 5 Tap on the ATM/Debit Card you would like to activate. 6 Step 6 Review your request and tap Activate Card to complete your card activation request. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Cards and select the Credit/ Debit/ ATM Card that you wish to activate. 4 Step 4 Under Card details, select Manage and click on Activate card. 5 Step 5 Verify your details and click on Activate now. 6 Step 6 Your card has been activated successfully. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card QR Code Digibank Activation Online Activation 1 Step 1 Scan the QR Code and log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Select the Card Type. 3 Step 3 Tap on the Card you would like to activate. 4 Step 4 Review your request and tap Activate Card to complete the activation. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! 1 Step 1 Scan the QR Code or Click on Activate Now below and proceed to enter your mobile number and the last 4 digits of the card you would like to activate. Activate Now 2 Step 2 Enter the 6 digit SMS Code sent to your mobile number and tap on Verify. 3 Step 3 Congratulations, you have successfully activated your card. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! DBS/POSB ATM Locate our nearest DBS/POSB ATM. Follow instructions on the ATM screen to complete activation. Insert your New Credit/Debit/ATM Card. Enter your New Card PIN*. Select More Services. Select Cards/PIN/iBanking/Unlock digiVault. Select Activate Card. *Note: If your card application is made online, use the PIN you have created. For activation of renewal card or damaged card replacement, please use the same PIN as your previous card, or the PIN you have created upon online application. If you have received a PIN mailer, you may visit any DBS/POSB ATM in Singapore with your card and PIN sent. If you did not receive a PIN mailer or have forgotten your PIN, you may activate your card and reset your PIN instantly via digibank. Find out how you can Reset Card PIN. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! DBS/POSB ATM Locate our nearest DBS/POSB ATM. Follow instructions on the ATM screen to complete activation. Insert your New Credit/Debit/ATM Card. Enter your New Card PIN*. Select More Services. Select Cards/PIN/iBanking/Unlock digiVault. Select Activate Card. *Note: If your card application is made online, use the PIN you have created. For activation of renewal card or damaged card replacement, please use the same PIN as your previous card, or the PIN you have created upon online application. If you have received a PIN mailer, you may visit any DBS/POSB ATM in Singapore with your card and PIN sent. If you did not receive a PIN mailer or have forgotten your PIN, you may activate your card and reset your PIN instantly via digibank. Find out how you can Reset Card PIN.

title: Enable/ Disable Card For In Store Overseas Use
full_text: Enable/ Disable Card For In Store Overseas Use Learn how to enable / disable your card's overseas usage easily using digibank or at our DBS/POSB ATM. Part of: Guides > Go Travel with DBS, Your Guide to Card Security Important information For your security, magnetic stripe transactions for overseas point-of-sale and ATM access on all DBS/POSB cards are disabled by default to reduce the risk of unauthorized transactions. For eCommerce, EMV chip, and contactless transactions will remain enabled for overseas use. When travelling overseas, enable Overseas contactless and card chip control to allow in-store purchases. Overseas contactless and card chip payments use EMV chip technology, offering a more secure option through cryptographic processes. Overseas magnetic stripe is located within your Payment Controls dashboard. Turn it on only if absolutely required. We strongly recommend using contactless or chip methods. Magnetic stripe transactions are less secure and more vulnerable to fraud, like skimming and cloning. You'll still find magnetic stripe payments in some countries, such as the USA, South Korea, and Japan. You are advised to disable your overseas controls if you are in Singapore. How to enable/ disable Card for in store overseas use There are various channels which you may enable/ disable card for in store overseas use with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More at the bottom, under Manage Cards & Loans, select Payment Controls. 3 Step 3 Select the Card you wish to enable/disable for in store overseas use and toggle the Switch On/Off under Overseas contactless and card chip to enable or disable the function. 4 Step 4 For magnetic stripe activation/ deactivation, tap on Overseas magnetic stripe and toggle the Switch On/Off to enable or disable the function. (Note: Turn on Overseas magnetic stripe only if required. If you can, pay via contactless or chip instead.) 5 Step 5 Select Set a start and end date* or Start now with no expiry date and click Next.â (Note: *Setting activation dates will auto-deactivate your card's overseas function after the specified end date.)â 6 Step 6 Verify the details and tap Confirm. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Cards, select the card that you wish to enable/disable for overseas use. 4 Step 4 Under Manage, select Overseas magnetic stripe. 5 Step 5 Toggle the switch On/Off to enable/disable your overseas magnetic stripe function. 6 Step 6 Select Set a start and end date* or Start now with no expiry date. (Note: *Setting activation dates will auto-deactivate your card's overseas function after the specified end date.)â 7 Step 7 Verify the details and click Confirm to enable/disable your card for overseas use. 8 Step 8 You have enable/disable your card for overseas use successfully. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS/POSB ATM in Singapore Insert your DBS/POSB Card to access your account Key in your PIN Select More Services Select Cardâs Magnetic Stripe for Overseas Use Select Continue Amend status of the overseas function of your Card's magnetic stripe to your preference Follow instructions on the ATM screen to complete Submission Find the nearest ATM using our Locator. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! title: Check Debit Card Transaction Details
full_text: Check Debit Card Transaction Details You can now check your debit card transaction details, whether it is settled, pending or declined via digibank mobile! How to view debit card transaction details There are various channels which you may use to view your debit card transaction details. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile You can now view details of pending and declined transactions, and up to past 6 months of transaction history via digibank mobile. 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home, tap on Deposits and select the account that you wish to view. 3 Step 3 You may view up to Past 6 Months of Transaction History including pending transactions. 4 Step 4 You may also view your Pending/Declined Transactions under the Pending Tab. Tap to view more details. 5 Step 5 Details of your transaction will be displayed. (You may retrieve useful transaction information such as category, payment type, transaction approval code and reason for decline on this page!) Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Cards and select the Card details. 4 Step 4 Select the Debit Card that you wish to check on. By default, your current monthâs transaction(s) will be displayed. Click on the transactions to view more details. 5 Step 5 Details of your transaction will be displayed. If you wish to share your transaction details, click on the Download icon at the top right. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions What are unbilled transactions? Unbilled transactions are completed transactions which will be reflected in your next statement. What are pending transactions? Pending transactions are recent debit card payments sent to the merchant that are yet to be processed on their end. These are normally put on hold for approximately 10 days after the transaction date, until the merchant settles and collects the funds. However, if there is no merchant settlement within this period, the pending transaction will be dropped. What are billed transactions (current statement)? Billed transactions are completed transactions which have been reflected in your statement and due for payment. Learn more about how you can check your statements here. What are declined transactions? Declined transactions are failed transactions where payment was unsuccessful and the merchant did not receive the payment. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Transact & Withdraw in Foreign Currency Overseas
full_text: Transact & Withdraw in Foreign Currency Overseas Enable your Card for overseas usage to transact and withdraw foreign currency overseas. Avoid foreign exchange and debit card fees by using a DBS Visa Debit Card linked to any of our multi-currency accounts (e.g. My Account or Multiplier). Part of: Guides > Go Travel with DBS, Go Shopping with DBS DBS & POSB ATM / Debit / Credit Cards Enable Card For Overseas Use Transacting of foreign currencies Withdrawal of foreign currencies For online/overseas foreign currency transactions fees, refer to Overseas Card Transaction Fees. For withdrawal of foreign currency overseas charges, refer to Overseas Withdrawal Charges. Match your card associationâs respective logos to the Overseas ATMs, for example: MasterCard - Cirrus or Maestro Logo VISA - Plus Logo Note: The total amount of cash that you can withdraw per day at both local and overseas ATMs is capped. This daily cash withdrawal limit applies regardless of the number of cards you have. Learn more about ATM cash withdrawal cap. DBS Visa Debit Card (linked with a DBS Multi-Currency Autosave (MCA) Account) Transact and withdraw up to 11 foreign currencies with no foreign exchange and debit card fees: Link your DBS Multi-Currency Autosave (MCA) Account with a DBS Visa Debit Card as the Primary Account. Deposit or Exchange Foreign Currencies in your DBS Multi-Currency Autosave (MCA) Account at your preferred rates via digibank online. Functionalities of linked DBS Visa Debit Card (Enable Card for Overseas Use): Point-of-sale purchases; Online purchases; Overseas ATM cash withdrawal*. Foreign currency transactions and withdrawals will be debited directly from the respective foreign currency wallet. Note: *Overseas Withdrawal Charges apply. Renminbi Offshore (CNH) is not available for these card payment features and all CNH transactions will be defaulted to SGD. If there are insufficient foreign currency funds in your Multi-Currency Autosave (MCA) Account, the entire foreign currency transaction will be deducted from your SGD funds. Should there be insufficient SGD funds, the entire transaction will be declined. Partial withdrawal or transaction is not available. Was this information useful? title: Replace Credit/Debit/ATM Card
full_text: Replace Credit/Debit/ATM Card Holding on to a damaged, worn out or lost your card? Request for a card replacement instantly using our self-service options. Part of: Guides > Card Replacements, Go Travel with DBS, Digital Services Important information Ensure that your address is updated before requesting for a card replacement. Need to update your address? Learn More. Take note of these information for card replacement. How to replace Credit/Debit/ATM Card There are various channels which you may replace your Credit/Debit/ATM card with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under Manage Cards & Loans, select Replace/Block Card. 4 Step 4 Select the Reason for Replacement. 5 Step 5 Select the Card you wish to replace. 6 Step 6 Enter Your Name to appear on the card. The name should not exceed 19 characters and it should not include any special symbols. Once done, tap on Next. 7 Step 7 Review your request and tap Replace Card. 8 Step 8 Your new card will be sent to you within 3 to 5 business days. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Cards and select the Card that you would like to replace. 4 Step 4 Under Card details, click Manage and select Replace damaged card. 5 Step 5 Select Credit Card or Debit Card. 6 Step 6 Select the card to be replaced. 7 Step 7 Confirm your mailing address for the card replacement and click Yes or No. 8 Step 8 Enter your name to appear on the card. 9 Step 9 Review your request and click Proceed. 10 Step 10 Your card has been replaced successfully and will be mailed to you within 3 to 5 working days. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS digibot 1 Step 1 Click on Digibot Icon located at the bottom right. 2 Step 2 Type Replace Card. 3 Step 3 Select Replace Damaged Card. 4 Step 4 Select Type of Card for replacement. 5 Step 5 Click Authenticate me to complete the authentication using either your iBanking Login or Card & PIN. 6 Step 6 Select the Card you wish to replace. 7 Step 7 Confirm your Mailing Address. 8 Step 8 Enter Your Name to appear on the card. The name should not exceed 19 characters and it should not include any special symbols. 9 Step 9 Click Proceed to submit your request and a new card will be sent to you within 3-5 business days. Launch our digibot now! Get Started More information You will receive your replacement Card* & PIN (if any) separately within 5 working days from the requested date. *Note: For activation of renewal card or damaged card replacement, use the same PIN as your previous card, or the PIN you have created upon online application. If you have received a PIN mailer, enter your PIN accordingly. If you did not receive a PIN mailer or have forgotten your PIN, you may activate your replacement card and reset your PIN instantly via digibank. Find out how you can Reset Card PIN. A replacement ATM/Debit/Credit Card is mailed to you 2 months prior to its expiry date, if you did not receive or had misplace your replacement card after its expiry date, please perform a manual replacement. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better.
