title: Apply for digibank
full_text: Apply for digibank Sign up for digibank to enjoy convenient banking anytime, anywhere. With digibank, you will gain access to a full range of digital services. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information For new to DBS or POSB customers, it is highly recommended to Register for Singpass so that you can open an account instantly. For digibank registration (mobile or online), if you have an ATM, Debit or Credit Card, ensure your card is activated before applying for digibank. Learn more on how you can Activate New Card.â Always keep your contact details updated and set transaction alerts to be informed instantly of any transactions on your account(s). DO NOT disclose your User ID, PIN or other identification numbers to anyone and NEVER save your password on your device.â Learn how to #BSHARP and bank safely online. How to Apply for digibank There are various channels which you may Apply for digibank with us. New DBS or POSB customer Customers who are at least 16 years old and does not have an existing account with DBS or POSB can open their first account directly using DBS digibank mobile.â Using Singpass Not using Singpass Hereâs a tip! Use Singpass to pre-populate information on your application and for instant account opening. 1 Step 1 Download the digibank mobile app from the App Store, Google Play or AppGallery. 2 Step 2 Launch the digibank mobile app and tap on Sign up for digibank. 3 Step 3 Swipe through the introduction screens and tap on I'm New to DBS/POSB. 4 Step 4 Tap Continue with Singpass, login with your Singpass and tap I Agree to retrieve your personal data. If you do not have Singpass, register online. You can refer to the Singpass Instructional Guide. Alternatively, you can tap on Continue without Singpass (see Not Using Singpass tab for the steps) 5 Step 5 Provide all required information in the succeeding screens including your occupation and industry. 6 Step 6 Declare your tax residency status. Select Yes if you are Singapore Tax Resident only. Otherwise, select No and add the country/jurisdiction(s) of your tax residency. Refer to theÂ Rules Governing Tax ResidenceÂ for information on the respective jurisdiction's tax residency rules. 7 Step 7 Tap on the suitable bundle to open an account. 8 Step 8 Complete the questions in the succeeding screens includingÂ Name on card & PIN. 9 Step 9 Upload Supporting Documents and tap Next, if required. Learn more about Documents Required for Account Opening. (Note: After submission, if additional document(s) is required, you will receive an email notification with the necessary instructions.) 10 Step 10 Input your preferred User ID & PIN to create your digibank Credentials. 11 Step 11 Review the details and tap Confirm Application to open your account. If you were required to upload supporting document, your application will be processed within 3 working days after we receive your complete application. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! Hereâs a tip! Prepare all supporting documents before starting your application to save time. 1 Step 1 Download the digibank mobile app from the App Store, Google Play or AppGallery. 2 Step 2 Launch the digibank mobile app and tap on Sign up for digibank. 3 Step 3 Swipe through the introduction screens and tap on I'm New to DBS/POSB. 4 Step 4 Tap Continue without Singpass and tap Sign up Manually. 5 Step 5 Provide all required information in the succeeding screens including your occupation and industry. 6 Step 6 Declare your tax residency status. Select Yes if you are Singapore Tax Resident only. Otherwise, select No and add the country/jurisdiction(s) of your tax residency. Refer to theÂ Rules Governing Tax ResidenceÂ for information on the respective jurisdiction's tax residency rules. 7 Step 7 Tap on the suitable bundle to open an account. 8 Step 8 Complete the questions in the succeeding screens includingÂ Name on card & PIN. 9 Step 9 Upload Supporting Documents and tap Next, if required. Learn more about Documents Required for Account Opening. (Note: After submission, if additional document(s) is required, you will receive an email notification with the necessary instructions.) 10 Step 10 Review the details and tap Confirm Application to open your account. Your application will be processed within 3 working days after we receive your complete application. Once approved, you will receive your debit card within 3-5 working days then proceed with the following steps: Activate your debit card. Learn more on how to Activate New Card. Once your card is activated, proceed to digibank mobile Registration. Once registered, login in digibank and set up your Digital Token when prompted. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank mobile registration Customers who are at least 16 years old and have existing account or cards with DBS or POSB can register for digibank access using DBS digibank mobile. 1 Step 1 Download the digibank mobile app from the App Store, Google Play or AppGallery. 2 Step 2 Launch the digibank mobile app and tap on Log In. 3 Step 3 Tap on Get Started to proceed. 4 Step 4 Fill in your personal details, and tap Next. 5 Step 5 Select your preferred authentication method. 6 Step 6 Fill in your Credentials. Input your preferred User ID & PIN. Verify your personal details and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Review details and tap Register now. 8 Step 8 Your digibank registration is complete. Tap Log in to digibank to set-up your digital token. Alternatively, if you prefer to use Physical Token, visit any of our branches or call DBS hotline to request one. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online registration Customers who are at least 16 years old and have existing account or cards with DBS or POSB can register for digibank access using DBS digibank online.â 1 Step 1 Log on to digibank online and click on Get Started to register and activate your digibank. 2 Step 2 Select your Identity Type, enter your Identity Number and Date of birth, click on Next. 3 Step 3 Select an option to verify, complete the Authentication Process and click on Next. 4 Step 4 Create your digibank credentials by inputting your details and preferred User ID & PIN. Click on Next. 5 Step 5 Review and confirm your User ID, mobile number, email address, mailing address and click on Register now. 6 Step 6 Your digibank registration is complete. Scan the QR code to download digibank app to set up your digital token. If you prefer to use Physical Token, visit any of our branches or contact DBS hotline to request one. Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions New DBS or POSB customer onboardingâ Who are eligible to open their first account using digibank mobile?â Customers who are at least 16 years old can open their first account directly using DBS digibank mobile.â Customers who do not have any product or services with DBS or POSB.â Customers who only have Joint-Trust account with their parents.â Customer who only have Paylah account with DBS. I have just registered for a Singpass account. When can I start using it to register for an account on digibank mobile?âââ Your Singpass/MyInfo profile should be up and ready to use the next day for new account application on your digibank app.â What if my mobile number or Registered Address* in Singpass is incorrect or outdated?âââ You may update your details in Singpass before you proceed with your application. *Your new debit card will be mailed to your registered address. I used Singpass to submit application however my account is not instantly opened, why?âââ If you were required to upload supporting document(s), additional processing is required for your application. Your application will be processed within 3 working days upon receiving complete application.â I do not have Singpass account, what are the requirements to open an account in digibank mobile?âââ You will need:â Valid mobile number, email address and residential address Supporting documents Does this account comes with an ATM or Debit card? Where can I get it?âââââ Yes, your account comes with a debit card. Once your application is approved, your debit card will also be sent to your residential address within 3-5 working days.â Where can I check the status of my account opening application?â You may check the status of your application in Application Status Portal.â Learn more on Check Account Opening Application Status.â digibank registration (For existing DBS or POSB customers) Who are eligible to register for digibank?â Customers who are at least 16 years old and have any of the following can register for digibank.â DBS Autosave/Current/Savings Plus or POSB Savings/Current Account (personal or joint)â.â Activated DBS or POSB Credit Card/Debit Cardâ.â DBS Cashline/Home Loan with Servicing Accountâ. Wealth Management Account (Non-corporate S-Account) with valid address. What are the requirements to register for digibank?â A valid personal or joint-alternate account.â Valid mobile number and email address.â Activated ATM, Debit, or Credit card, Physical Token, or Temporary UID, or Singpass account (applicable for Singapore and Permanent Residents only)â. How can I register for digibank?â You may register for digibank via digibank mobile app or digibank online.â To register on digibank mobileâ: Download the latest version of DBS digibank or POSB digibank in the official App Store, Google Play Store and Huawei App Gallery.â Follow the steps on digibank mobile Registration above.â To register on digibank onlineâ: Go to digibank online. Follow the steps on digibank online Registration above.â I am getting error message when I try to register for digibank, what should I do?ââ Check the personal details that you entered. For example, if you are using Passport, ensure that you enter the same passport number that you used when you opened an account.â Check the authentication option that you selected. If you are using card, ensure that you selected the correct card type.â If you are not using card to authenticate, ensure you have valid mobile number in the bankâs recordâ. If you are using digibank online to register, you may try to use digibank mobile.â How can I update my mobile number and email address?âââ You may click on the links to know how to update your mobile number and email address.â Can I update my mobile number and email address during digibank registration?âââ Yes, you may update your mobile and email address only if you are using activated ATM, Debit or Credit Card to register. A registration code will be sent to your mailing address to confirm your updated mobile number and/or email, and to setup your digital token. I am getting error when I use Singpass Face verification, what should I do?âââ Ensure that you have a photo registered with Singpassâ. Ensure that you have valid mobile number in the bankâs record. You may use other authentication method or you may try again later. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Open an Account with DBS/POSB Documents Required for Account Opening Set up your Digital Token Related articles Open an Account with DBS/POSB Documents Required for Account Opening Set up your Digital Token

title: Reset/Retrieve digibank User ID and/or PIN
full_text: Reset/Retrieve digibank User ID and/or PIN You can reset or retrieve your User ID and reset your PIN using our digital channels. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information digibank User ID must be between 5 to 20 characters and contains letters and numbers only. To retrieve your digibank User ID online, you need to have a registered iB Secure Device or registered mobile to receive SMS One-Time-Password (OTP). digibank PIN must be between 6 to 9 digit numbers. How to change/ retrieve digibank User ID DBS Website (Retrieving your forgotten digibank User ID) 1 Step 1 Visit our digibank online Login Page and click on Forgot User ID. 2 Step 2 Enter yourÂ Identity Type,Â Identity NumberÂ andÂ Date of Birth. Click Next. 3 Step 3 Authenticate your request using yourÂ Debit/ATM card detailsÂ orÂ Physical Token (DBS Secure Device). 4 Step 4 Verify using SMS OTP or Physical Token (DBS Secure Device) If you did not receive the SMS OTP, you can restart your device and try again. If your mobile number is incorrect, learn how you canÂ update your mobile number. 5 Step 5 Your User ID will be successfully displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More at the bottom and select Change User ID/PIN. 3 Step 3 Tap on Change User ID. 4 Step 4 Enter your new User ID and tap Next. 5 Step 5 Verify the details and tap on Change ID Now. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security-related settings, click on Login & Security. 5 Step 5 Under User ID, enter your New User ID and click Save to successfully change your User ID. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card How to reset digibank PIN There are various channels which you may reset your digibank PIN with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile Forget Existing PIN Change New PIN Launch your digibank mobile app and select Log In. Tap Forgot your PIN?, and indicate your Identity Type, Identity Number and Date of Birth. Tap Next and select the option that you like to identify yourself via: Debit / ATM Card; OR DBS Secure Device (Token) After identification, Enter New PIN and tap on Set New PIN to complete the reset of your digibank PIN. Don't have digibank? Get the latest digibank mobile App now! 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More at the bottom and select Change User ID/PIN. 3 Step 3 Tap on Change User PIN. 4 Step 4 Enter your existing and new PIN and tap Change PIN now. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security-related settings, click on Login & Security. 5 Step 5 Under PIN, enter your New PIN and click Save to successfully change your digibank PIN. 6 Step 6 You have change your digibank PIN successfully. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS Website 1 Step 1 Visit our digibank online login page and click onÂ Forgot PIN. 2 Step 2 Enter yourÂ Identity Type,Â Identity NumberÂ andÂ Date of Birth. Click Next. 3 Step 3 Authenticate your request using yourÂ Debit/ATM card detailsÂ orÂ Physical Token (DBS Secure Device). 4 Step 4 Verify using SMS OTP or Physical Token (DBS Secure Device) If you did not receive the SMS OTP, you can restart your device and try again. If your mobile number is incorrect, learn how you canÂ update your mobile number. 5 Step 5 Enter your New PIN and proceed to Re-enter new PIN. Click Create new PIN to successfully reset your digibank PIN. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles Reset Card PIN Activate New Card Replace Credit/Debit/ATM Card Update Mobile Number Related articles Reset Card PIN Activate New Card Replace Credit/Debit/ATM Card Update Mobile Number

faq_pairs.question: Forgot your PIN?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap Next and select the option that you like to identify yourself via: Debit / ATM Card; OR DBS Secure Device (Token) After identification, Enter New PIN and tap on Set New PIN to complete the reset of your digibank PIN.

faq_pairs.question: Don't have digibank?
faq_pairs.answer: Get the latest digibank mobile App now!

title: DBS Manage Alerts, Offers & Insights Notifications
full_text: DBS Manage Alerts, Offers & Insights Notifications Learn how you can customize your notification alerts via digibank for transactions and content preferences, including threshold amounts and delivery methods (e.g. email, push notifications). Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information The default threshold for funds transfer notification alert is set at S$100. The default threshold settings for notification alerts on all DBS/POSB cards is S$500, with notifications sent via email, push notifications, and SMS. This applies to all card transactions (including cash advance) made via AMEX, Mastercard, NETS, UnionPay or Visa. You will only receive notification alerts for Retail Transactions. Retail Transactions are one-time purchases of goods or services for personal use, made in-store or online. Examples include buying groceries, purchasing clothes, ordering a meal at a restaurant, or buying a book online. Recurring TransactionsÂ will not trigger notification alerts. They are regular, automated payments (monthly/annually) for goods or services, such as subscription services (Netflix), utility bills (SP), telco bills (Starhub/Singtel/M1), and loan payments. To receive push notifications, ensure that you have turned on push notifications for your digibank mobile app. Learn more on how to enable push notifications for your digibank. For all bank-defined high-risk transactions, notifications will be sent via SMS, email and push notifications, regardless of your selected notification preferences. For enhanced security, email and push notification alerts are mandatory for Digital transactions and Personal account updates. You will need to select either email or SMS along with push notification for alerts. Selecting of push notification only is not allowed. For changes on Offers & Insights Notifications settings, it will take up to 3 business days to take effect. How to manage alerts for Banking Accounts There are various channels which you may manage alerts for your banking accounts with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under App & Security Settings, tap on Manage Notifications. 4 Step 4 Under Accounts, customise your alert preferences and tap Next. (Note: Email and push notification alerts for digital transactions and personal account updates cannot be turned off.) 5 Step 5 Review your details and tap Submit. 6 Step 6 You have successfully updated your notification alerts. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security & Preference, click on Notifications. 5 Step 5 Under Accounts, customise your alert preferences and click Next. (Note: For push notification alerts, you will need to select along with either email or SMS.) 6 Step 6 Verify your changes and click Submit and complete the 2-Factor Authentication to update ur notification preferences. 7 Step 7 You have successfully updated your notifications alerts. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card How to manage alerts for DBS/POSB Card(s) There are various channels which you may manage alerts for your DBS/POSB Cards with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch/Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under App & Security Settings, tap on Manage Notifications. 4 Step 4 Tap on Cards and select the card you would like to Manage Alerts. 5 Step 5 Customise your alert preferences for the selected card and tap Next. (Note: For push notification alerts, you will need to select along with either email or SMS.) 6 Step 6 Review your details and tap Submit. 7 Step 7 You have successfully customised your notification alerts. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security & Preference, click on Notifications. 5 Step 5 Click on Cards, customise your alert preferences and click Next. (Note: For push notification alerts, you will need to select along with either email or SMS.) 6 Step 6 Review your changes and click Submit and complete the 2-Factor Authentication to update ur notification preferences. 7 Step 7 You have successfully updated your notifications alerts. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card How to manage DBS Offers & Insights Notifications There are various channels which you may manage Offers & Insights notifications with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. Tap on More to proceed. 2 Step 2 Tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under App & Security Settings, tap on Manage Notifications. 4 Step 4 Tap on Offers and Insights and customise your notifications for: Card offers Product offers Insights and events Tap Next to proceed. 5 Step 5 Review the changes and tap on Submit to proceed. 6 Step 6 You have successfully submitted your notification alert request. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security & Preference, click on Notifications. 5 Step 5 Click on Offers & Insights, customise your alert preferences and click Next. (Note: For push notification alerts, you will need to select along with either email or SMS.) 6 Step 6 Review your changes and click Submit and complete the 2-Factor Authentication to update ur notification preferences. 7 Step 7 You have successfully change your notifications alerts. An email will be sent to your registered email address after the successful submission. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card How to manage alerts for Wealth Management There are various channels which you may manage your wealth management notification with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile (Wealth) 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. Tap on More to proceed. 2 Step 2 Tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under App & Security Settings, tap on Manage Notifications. 4 Step 4 Tap on Wealth management and customise your notifications for: Corporate action, eAdvice, research subscription Account review, passport update Investment alerts such as MRTL, IPO and placement Price alerts for Equity, fixed income, Funds and FX 5 Step 5 Customise your alert preferences and tap Next. 6 Step 6 Review your details and tap Submit. 7 Step 7 You have successfully customised your notification alerts. Get the latest DBS digibank Wealth app now! digibank online (Wealth) 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Your Profile at the top right of your digibank and select Profile & Settings. 4 Step 4 Under Security-related settings, click on Notifications. 5 Step 5 Click on Wealth management and customise your notifications for: Corporate action, eAdvice, research subscription Account review, passport update Investment alerts such as MRTL, IPO and placement Price alerts for Equity, fixed income, Funds and FX 6 Step 6 Customise your alert preferences and click Next. 7 Step 7 Verify your changes and click Submit to proceed. 8 Step 8 You have successfully change your notifications alerts. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions Offers & Insights Notifications What is this feature about? You can now customise the types of content and the channel to receive offers and insights notifications. To opt in for personalised content, simply follow the instructions above to manage your preferences. What should I be aware of if I choose to âTurn Off Notificationsâ? You will no longer receive any Card offers, Product offers and Insights if you choose to âTurn off Notificationsâ when prompted in digibank mobile. You will still get important transaction notifications based on your banking alert preferences. Itâs how we keep your account secure with us. How do I update my preferences if I change my mind? Update your preferences anytime via digibank mobile by following the steps above. Notifications Inbox (Promos) is not showing any messages. Why is that so? Youâll need to ensure that your push notification preference is opted in to receive messages in your notification inbox. Click on More tab > Manage Notifications to update. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Switch your digibank mobile to Simple Mode
full_text: Switch your digibank mobile to Simple Mode Find out how you can switch your digibank mobile to Simple Mode and personalise your app. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank How to switch to simple mode Switch to Simple Mode Switch to Full Mode 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home page, select Quick Links. 3 Step 3 Select Simple Mode. You may tap on Customise to arrange the quicklinks services (Optional). 4 Step 4 Tap and Hold to Drag and Rearrange the quicklinks in your preferred order. Once done, tap on the Back Button to preview your changes. 5 Step 5 Tap Save to complete your personalisation. title: Link insurance policies to DBS NAV Planner
full_text: Link insurance policies to DBS NAV Planner Retrieve and link your insurance policies with Singpass and enjoy effortless insurance planning. Find out your total insurance coverage, premiums, needs and more today! Important information Your government related savings accounts like CPF will be displayed within DBS NAV Planner when you connect to SGFindex. title: Unlink Financial Institution from SGFinDex

title: Understanding Multiplierâs Interest and Eligible Transactions
full_text: Understanding Multiplierâs Interest and Eligible Transactions Find out how the interest is calculated and the eligible transactions under each product category for Multiplier Account. How is the interest calculated? The preferential interest rate is applied to the end-day SGD balance in your DBS Multiplier Account. Interest earned for each balance tier is calculated and rounded off to the nearest 4 decimal places. Each dayâs interest earned is summed up and rounded off to the nearest 2 decimal places. The entire month's interest is then summed up. Calculate my Multiplier preferential interest. What are the eligible transactions under each product category? Learn more about different categories for Multiplier Account. faq_pairs.question: How is the interest calculated?
faq_pairs.answer: How to view my eligible transactions in Bank & Earn Summary There are various channels which you may Understanding Multiplierâs Interest and Eligible Transactions with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Deposits, tap on your DBS Multiplier Account. 3 Step 3 Tap on Eligible Transactions to access Bank & Earn Summary. 4 Step 4 View your eligible transactions breakdown and the interest rate you qualify for. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits and select your Multiplier account. 4 Step 4 Click on the Bank & Earn at the top. Your eligible transactions breakdown and the interest rate you qualify for will be displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Frequently Asked Questions Income Q1) What should I do if my salary credit is not recognised? You can inform your company HR to use GIRO code 22 when they process the payroll/salary file to their corporate bank. Q2) If I have a joint account, how will our income transactions be recognised? The combined total salary and dividend credits in that joint account will be recognised under the individual Multiplier Accounts. Example 1: John and Mary credit their salaries (S$3,000 and S$3,100 respectively) and dividends (S$500 each) into their joint POSB savings account. They have their own Multiplier Accounts and are accorded a total income amount of S$7,100 each. Example 2: George credits his salary of S$4,000 into a joint POSB savings account shared with Emily. Emily does not have an income. They have their own Multiplier Accounts and are accorded a total income amount of S$4,000 each. Credit Card Spend Q1) What are the eligible credit card transactions? Only posted retail and cash advance transactions will be recognised as eligible credit card spend. Balance transfers, instalment payment plans, preferred payment plans, and any fees / charges imposed by the bank are not eligible. Example: Transaction date: 30 Aug Credit card spend is made at a merchant. Posting date: 1 Sep Transaction is posted to your credit card account. This transaction is therefore recognised under Septemberâs credit card spend (not August). Q2) Do I have to link my Multiplier Account to my DBS/POSB Credit Card in order for my credit card transactions to be recognised? No. Eligible credit card transactions are automatically detected across all the personal DBS/POSB Credit Cards held by you. Multiplier Account recognises credit card transactions made via American ExpressÂ® /MasterCardÂ® /Visa. Insurance Q1) I wish to change my premium payment frequency e.g. yearly to monthly or vice versa. Will my policy still be recognised for this month? In the event that there are changes to the insurance policy, the monthly premium will cease to be included as an eligible transaction. This will take effect from the month where the changes are made. Changes can include but are not limited to change in premium payment frequency and reassignment of policy ownership. Q2) I was late in paying my premium due this month. Will my policy still be recognised as eligible transaction for this month? Yes. Your policy will still be recognised as long as your policy is still in force. Q3) If my policy premium due is paid quarterly/annually, how is the transaction recognised? We will derive the monthly premium amount from dividing the annualised premiums by 12. Q4) How to check the number of eligible months that I have paid for my insurance policy? You may view the breakdown of eligible months for your insurance transaction via Bank & Earn Summary in digibank mobile. Investment Q1) If my investments are in foreign currency, how will they be recognised? Investment transactions will be recognised as the Singapore dollar equivalent at DBSâ prevailing exchange rate. Q2) If the investment amount is deducted from a joint DBS/POSB deposit account, will the transaction be recognised for both account holders? The transaction will be accorded to the investment applicant only. Q3) How to check the number of eligible months that I have paid for my investment policy? You may view the breakdown of eligible months for your investment transaction via Bank & Earn Summary in digibank mobile. DBS Invest-Saver Q1) Can I terminate my existing DBS Invest-Saver and re-purchase to be recognised? No. For the re-purchase to be recognised, the fund has to be terminated and fully redeemed for at least 6 months from the date of termination or date of full redemption, whichever is later. Alternatively, you may consider purchasing a new fund to continue recognition. Example: Termination Date 29 April Full Redemption Date 30 April Re-purchase Set Up Date Re-purchase after 30 October will be recognised Q2) I have just signed up for DBS Invest-Saver. How will it be recognised? DBS Invest-Saver will be recognised in the same month if you sign up before the deduction date, 15th of the month (or the next business day if the 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday). Else, it will be recognised the next month. It will be recognised for the first 12 consecutive months after the free-look/cancellation period or 4 calendar days after the settlement date. Example: Deduction Date 15 April (or next business day if 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday) Settlement Date 21 April (3 to 4 working days, depending on fund house) Recognition Date 25 April (4 calendar days after the settlement date) Q3) If I change the amount of my existing DBS Invest-Saver within the 12-month period, will it be recognised? Yes, you may update the amount and it will be recognised if deduction is successful Q4) My DBS Invest-Saver contribution is not recognised for the month. Why is that so? Recognition of the monthly contributions as eligible transactions will cease from the month where there is any failed deduction, or the DBS Invest-Saver is terminated. Online Equity Trade Q1) What transactions are ineligible for higher interest? The following transactions are ineligible: Contra trades, sell trades, and trades executed via Trading Representatives and DBS Vickers Customer Service Line. Q2) If I have an joint DBS Wealth Management Account, will the transaction be recognised for both account holders? For joint DBS Wealth Management Account, the equity trades will be recognised in full for each joint account holder under their individual DBS Multiplier Accounts. PayLah! Q1) What are the eligible PayLah! Retail Spend transactions? Non-Eligible Transactions include Peer-to-Peer (P2P) fund transfers via PayLah! message, mobile number, QR Code & Payment Link, eGift, QR Gift. Q2) I have only PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? Preferential interest will be accorded to age 29 years old and below. You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. Q3) My salary is credited to DBS/POSB account and I have PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles DBS Multiplier Account Related articles DBS Multiplier Account

Example: Termination Date 29 April Full Redemption Date 30 April Re-purchase Set Up Date Re-purchase after 30 October will be recognised Q2) I have just signed up for DBS Invest-Saver. How will it be recognised? DBS Invest-Saver will be recognised in the same month if you sign up before the deduction date, 15th of the month (or the next business day if the 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday). Else, it will be recognised the next month. It will be recognised for the first 12 consecutive months after the free-look/cancellation period or 4 calendar days after the settlement date. Example: Deduction Date 15 April (or next business day if 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday) Settlement Date 21 April (3 to 4 working days, depending on fund house) Recognition Date 25 April (4 calendar days after the settlement date) Q3) If I change the amount of my existing DBS Invest-Saver within the 12-month period, will it be recognised? Yes, you may update the amount and it will be recognised if deduction is successful Q4) My DBS Invest-Saver contribution is not recognised for the month. Why is that so? Recognition of the monthly contributions as eligible transactions will cease from the month where there is any failed deduction, or the DBS Invest-Saver is terminated. Online Equity Trade Q1) What transactions are ineligible for higher interest? The following transactions are ineligible: Contra trades, sell trades, and trades executed via Trading Representatives and DBS Vickers Customer Service Line. Q2) If I have an joint DBS Wealth Management Account, will the transaction be recognised for both account holders? For joint DBS Wealth Management Account, the equity trades will be recognised in full for each joint account holder under their individual DBS Multiplier Accounts. PayLah! Q1) What are the eligible PayLah! Retail Spend transactions? Non-Eligible Transactions include Peer-to-Peer (P2P) fund transfers via PayLah! message, mobile number, QR Code & Payment Link, eGift, QR Gift. Q2) I have only PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? Preferential interest will be accorded to age 29 years old and below. You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. Q3) My salary is credited to DBS/POSB account and I have PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. Related articles DBS Multiplier Account Related articles DBS Multiplier Account

sections.heading: Understanding Multiplierâs Interest and Eligible Transactions
sections.content: Find out how the interest is calculated and the eligible transactions under each product category for Multiplier Account.

sections.heading: How is the interest calculated?
sections.content: The preferential interest rate is applied to the end-day SGD balance in your DBS Multiplier Account. Interest earned for each balance tier is calculated and rounded off to the nearest 4 decimal places. Each dayâs interest earned is summed up and rounded off to the nearest 2 decimal places. The entire month's interest is then summed up. Calculate my Multiplier preferential interest.

sections.heading: How to view my eligible transactions in Bank & Earn Summary
sections.content: There are various channels which you may Understanding Multiplierâs Interest and Eligible Transactions with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Deposits, tap on your DBS Multiplier Account. 3 Step 3 Tap on Eligible Transactions to access Bank & Earn Summary. 4 Step 4 View your eligible transactions breakdown and the interest rate you qualify for. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits and select your Multiplier account. 4 Step 4 Click on the Bank & Earn at the top. Your eligible transactions breakdown and the interest rate you qualify for will be displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? sections.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
sections.content: Income Q1) What should I do if my salary credit is not recognised? You can inform your company HR to use GIRO code 22 when they process the payroll/salary file to their corporate bank. Q2) If I have a joint account, how will our income transactions be recognised? The combined total salary and dividend credits in that joint account will be recognised under the individual Multiplier Accounts. Example 1: John and Mary credit their salaries (S$3,000 and S$3,100 respectively) and dividends (S$500 each) into their joint POSB savings account. They have their own Multiplier Accounts and are accorded a total income amount of S$7,100 each. Example 2: George credits his salary of S$4,000 into a joint POSB savings account shared with Emily. Emily does not have an income. They have their own Multiplier Accounts and are accorded a total income amount of S$4,000 each. Credit Card Spend Q1) What are the eligible credit card transactions? Only posted retail and cash advance transactions will be recognised as eligible credit card spend. Balance transfers, instalment payment plans, preferred payment plans, and any fees / charges imposed by the bank are not eligible. Example: Transaction date: 30 Aug Credit card spend is made at a merchant. Posting date: 1 Sep Transaction is posted to your credit card account. This transaction is therefore recognised under Septemberâs credit card spend (not August). Q2) Do I have to link my Multiplier Account to my DBS/POSB Credit Card in order for my credit card transactions to be recognised? No. Eligible credit card transactions are automatically detected across all the personal DBS/POSB Credit Cards held by you. Multiplier Account recognises credit card transactions made via American ExpressÂ® /MasterCardÂ® /Visa. Insurance Q1) I wish to change my premium payment frequency e.g. yearly to monthly or vice versa. Will my policy still be recognised for this month? In the event that there are changes to the insurance policy, the monthly premium will cease to be included as an eligible transaction. This will take effect from the month where the changes are made. Changes can include but are not limited to change in premium payment frequency and reassignment of policy ownership. Q2) I was late in paying my premium due this month. Will my policy still be recognised as eligible transaction for this month? Yes. Your policy will still be recognised as long as your policy is still in force. Q3) If my policy premium due is paid quarterly/annually, how is the transaction recognised? We will derive the monthly premium amount from dividing the annualised premiums by 12. Q4) How to check the number of eligible months that I have paid for my insurance policy? You may view the breakdown of eligible months for your insurance transaction via Bank & Earn Summary in digibank mobile. Investment Q1) If my investments are in foreign currency, how will they be recognised? Investment transactions will be recognised as the Singapore dollar equivalent at DBSâ prevailing exchange rate. Q2) If the investment amount is deducted from a joint DBS/POSB deposit account, will the transaction be recognised for both account holders? The transaction will be accorded to the investment applicant only. Q3) How to check the number of eligible months that I have paid for my investment policy? You may view the breakdown of eligible months for your investment transaction via Bank & Earn Summary in digibank mobile. DBS Invest-Saver Q1) Can I terminate my existing DBS Invest-Saver and re-purchase to be recognised? No. For the re-purchase to be recognised, the fund has to be terminated and fully redeemed for at least 6 months from the date of termination or date of full redemption, whichever is later. Alternatively, you may consider purchasing a new fund to continue recognition. Example: Termination Date 29 April Full Redemption Date 30 April Re-purchase Set Up Date Re-purchase after 30 October will be recognised Q2) I have just signed up for DBS Invest-Saver. How will it be recognised? DBS Invest-Saver will be recognised in the same month if you sign up before the deduction date, 15th of the month (or the next business day if the 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday). Else, it will be recognised the next month. It will be recognised for the first 12 consecutive months after the free-look/cancellation period or 4 calendar days after the settlement date. Example: Deduction Date 15 April (or next business day if 15th is a Sunday or Public Holiday) Settlement Date 21 April (3 to 4 working days, depending on fund house) Recognition Date 25 April (4 calendar days after the settlement date) Q3) If I change the amount of my existing DBS Invest-Saver within the 12-month period, will it be recognised? Yes, you may update the amount and it will be recognised if deduction is successful Q4) My DBS Invest-Saver contribution is not recognised for the month. Why is that so? Recognition of the monthly contributions as eligible transactions will cease from the month where there is any failed deduction, or the DBS Invest-Saver is terminated. Online Equity Trade Q1) What transactions are ineligible for higher interest? The following transactions are ineligible: Contra trades, sell trades, and trades executed via Trading Representatives and DBS Vickers Customer Service Line. Q2) If I have an joint DBS Wealth Management Account, will the transaction be recognised for both account holders? For joint DBS Wealth Management Account, the equity trades will be recognised in full for each joint account holder under their individual DBS Multiplier Accounts. PayLah! Q1) What are the eligible PayLah! Retail Spend transactions? Non-Eligible Transactions include Peer-to-Peer (P2P) fund transfers via PayLah! message, mobile number, QR Code & Payment Link, eGift, QR Gift. Q2) I have only PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? Preferential interest will be accorded to age 29 years old and below. You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. Q3) My salary is credited to DBS/POSB account and I have PayLah! Retail Spend for the month. How will the interest be computed? You may refer to FAQs for Multiplier for more information. title: Open a Fixed Deposit Account
full_text: Open a Fixed Deposit Account Apply for a DBS Fixed Deposit Account with us via digibank. Important information DBS Fixed Deposit Account gives you the opportunity to maximise your savings in Singapore dollars and foreign currencies with fixed interest within the same account, while keeping your funds secured. You must be an existing digibank user with a personal or joint-alternate DBS/POSB Savings or Current Account. Learn more about how to Open an Account with DBS/POSB. Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be based on prevailing interest rates. SGD Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be computed based on the Total SGD Fixed Deposit Balances, instead of each placement and/or renewal. Examples My Fixed Deposit account has 2 placements which sum up to S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The total Fixed Deposit account balance is S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $100,000 - $249,999 range will apply. I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal. How to open a Fixed Deposit account digibank mobile You must be at least 16 years old to open an account and can hold only 1 personal DBS Fixed Deposit. 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home page, tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under Apply, select Deposit Accounts. 4 Step 4 Select Fixed Deposit Account. 5 Step 5 Select a Reference Account for Address and tap Next. 6 Step 6 Review Account Application and tap Open Account Now to complete your account opening. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online You must be at least 18 years old to open an account and can hold only 1 personal DBS Fixed Deposit Account. 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Apply on the left menu and under Bank, click on Fixed Deposits. 4 Step 4 Click Apply now to proceed with the application. 5 Step 5 Read through the information on the account opening and click Start. 6 Step 6 Select your Reference Account for Signature & Address and click Next. 7 Step 7 Ensure the details are correct, and click Submit to complete your Fixed Deposit account opening. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information If you apply for a new account between Mondays to Sundays (including Public Holidays), 0700 hr to 2230 hr, your account will be opened instantly. Should the account be opened on the last day of the month, applications made between 0700 hr and 2000 hr will be opened immediately. Beyond this period, account opening will take 2 working days (including Public Holidays). You will receive your monthly statement if there is any transaction(s) made for the month. Should you wish to view any of the transactions before receiving the statements, you may do so via digibank online/mobile. Trust Fixed Deposit Acount is not available, you may choose to open a Current or Savings Account. Learn more information on Fixed Deposits rates. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. The total Fixed Deposit account balance is S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $100,000 - $249,999 range will apply. I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal.

sections.heading: How to open a Fixed Deposit account
sections.content: digibank mobile You must be at least 16 years old to open an account and can hold only 1 personal DBS Fixed Deposit. 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Under Home page, tap on More. 3 Step 3 Under Apply, select Deposit Accounts. 4 Step 4 Select Fixed Deposit Account. 5 Step 5 Select a Reference Account for Address and tap Next. 6 Step 6 Review Account Application and tap Open Account Now to complete your account opening. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online You must be at least 18 years old to open an account and can hold only 1 personal DBS Fixed Deposit Account. 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Apply on the left menu and under Bank, click on Fixed Deposits. 4 Step 4 Click Apply now to proceed with the application. 5 Step 5 Read through the information on the account opening and click Start. 6 Step 6 Select your Reference Account for Signature & Address and click Next. 7 Step 7 Ensure the details are correct, and click Submit to complete your Fixed Deposit account opening. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card

sections.heading: More information
sections.content: If you apply for a new account between Mondays to Sundays (including Public Holidays), 0700 hr to 2230 hr, your account will be opened instantly. Should the account be opened on the last day of the month, applications made between 0700 hr and 2000 hr will be opened immediately. Beyond this period, account opening will take 2 working days (including Public Holidays). You will receive your monthly statement if there is any transaction(s) made for the month. Should you wish to view any of the transactions before receiving the statements, you may do so via digibank online/mobile. Trust Fixed Deposit Acount is not available, you may choose to open a Current or Savings Account. Learn more information on Fixed Deposits rates.

title: Fixed Deposit Placement
full_text: Fixed Deposit Placement Learn how you can make DBS Fixed Deposit placements via digibank. Important information DBS Fixed Deposit allows you to place both SGD and Foreign currency within the same account. The minimum placement amount and period are: For SGD Fixed Deposit, the minimum amount is S$1,000, with a choice of tenors from 1 month onwards. For Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit, the minimum amount is S$5,000 equivalent, with a choice of tenors from 1 day onwards. For Premier Income Accounts, the minimum amount is S$10,000, with a choice of tenors from 6 months onwards. Upon maturity, the Fixed Deposit placement (including interest) will be renewed automatically based on the same tenor at the prevailing interest rate, unless you provide us with other instructions at least 1 working day before the maturity via digibank. Learn more on how to change your Fixed Deposit maturity instructions. SGD Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be computed based on the Total SGD Fixed Deposit Balances, instead of each placement and/or renewal. Examples My FD account has an existing S$19,999 placement and I want to place another S$40,000. What is the applicable interest rate for the new S$40,000 placement? With the new S$40,000 placement, the total FD account balance will be S$59,999 (S$19,999 + S$40,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply My Fixed Deposit account has 2 placements which sum up to S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The total Fixed Deposit account balance is S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $100,000 - $249,999 range will apply. I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal. Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be based on prevailing interest rates. How to make a Fixed Deposit Placement digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Select Deposits and tap on Fixed Deposit Account. 3 Step 3 Select Place Deposit to make a new Fixed Deposit placement. 4 Step 4 Select the Account you wish to transfer from, Currency, Amount, Placement Period and tap Next. 5 Step 5 Select your preferred Maturity Instruction. 6 Step 6 For Withdraw Principal and Interest and Renew Principal and Withdraw Interest instructions, select the account for proceed to be credited into. 7 Step 7 For foreign currency placements, you can choose to credit proceeds into your SGD or foreign currency wallet upon maturity*. *When the transaction involves conversion of one foreign currency to another, foreign currency deposits are subject to exchange rates which may give rise to capital gains or losses. You can select the same currency as your foreign currency Fixed Deposit to prevent this. 8 Step 8 Tap Next. Review the details and tap Submit to complete the placement. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! More information SGD fixed deposit placements are available from 3:00 am to 11:30 pm daily, and on the last working day of the month from 3:00 am to 8:30 pm. Foreign currency transactions are available during working days from 9:00 am and 9:00 pm (SG local time). On the last working day of each month, foreign currency transactions are available from 9:00 am to 8:30 pm. Working days are from Monday to Friday, excluding Public Holidays. digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, and select your Fixed Deposit account. 4 Step 4 Under Placements, click Place Fixed Deposit. 5 Step 5 Select your preferred Currency, Amount and debiting account. Click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify your placement details and click Place now. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Foreign currency transactions are available during working days from 9:00 am and 9:00 pm (SG local time). On the last working day of each month, foreign currency transactions are available from 9:00 am to 8:30 pm. Working days are from Monday to Friday, excluding Public Holidays. digibank mobile (wealth) Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. Complete the Authentication Process. Under Invest, select Fixed Deposit. Select the Currency and Account you wish to place the fixed deposit in. Enter the Amount, select Placement Period, Maturity Instructions and tap Review. Verify your details and tap Submit to submit your Fixed Deposit placement request. More information You can place Fixed Deposits in 11 different currencies: SGD, USD, HKD, GBP, CAD, CNH, AUD, EUR, JPY, NZD & CHF(CHF is only available for DBS Treasures Private Clients and DBS Private Banking Clients). Select the debiting account, the placement period and the Maturity instructions. Click Next. 5 Step 5 Verify your placement details and click Place now to confirm your placement request. title: Fixed Deposit Premature Withdrawal
full_text: Fixed Deposit Premature Withdrawal Learn how to make a premature withdrawal from your DBS Fixed Deposit Account via digibank online. Important information For premature withdrawals of SGD Fixed Deposits, any interest will be calculated at the Bank's lowest applicable deposit rate, subject to change. For premature withdrawals of foreign currency Fixed Deposits, no interest will be payable For SGD Fixed Deposit, you will be able to check the interest received during your Fixed Deposit premature withdrawal request via digibank. The principal and interest will be renewed automatically based on the same tenor at the prevailing interest rate, unless you provide us with other instructions at least 1 working day before the maturity via digibank. (For withdrawal of Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit, please bring along NRIC/Passport to nearest full service branches.) Withdrawal of SGD and/or Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit placement is not allowed on the day of maturity or 1 day before maturity date. How to withdraw a SGD Fixed Deposit digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, and select your fixed deposit account. 4 Step 4 Under Placements, click Placement that you wish to withdraw. 5 Step 5 Click Manage at the top and select Withdraw to withdraw your Fixed Deposit placement. 6 Step 6 Your Premature Withdrawal Details will be shown. Select an account for the Net balance to be credited and click Next. 7 Step 7 Verify your withdrawal request and click Withdraw now to proceed with the withdrawal. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information This service may be unavailable from 11.00pm to 5.00am daily, and on the last working day of the month from 8.00pm to 5.00am. Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit, SRS SGD Fixed Deposit and SGD Structured Deposit accounts are not eligible for withdrawal via this service. Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: Change Fixed Deposit Maturity Instructions
full_text: Change Fixed Deposit Maturity Instructions Learn how you can change maturity instructions for your DBS Fixed Deposit Account via digibank. Important information Change of maturity instructions will not be allowed on the day of maturity. The principal and interest will be renewed automatically based on the same tenor at the prevailing interest rate, unless you provide us with other instructions at least 1 working day before the maturity via digibank. SGD Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be computed based on the Total SGD Fixed Deposit Balances, instead of each placement and/or renewal. Examples My Fixed Deposit account has 2 placements which sum up to S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The total Fixed Deposit account balance is S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $100,000 - $249,999 range will apply. I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal. Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be based on prevailing interest rates. Learn more on the Fixed Deposit placement rates. For earmarked Fixed Deposits, visit any DBS/POSB branch to update your maturity instructions. How to change Fixed Deposit maturity instructions There are various channels which you may change Fixed Deposit maturity instructions with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to your digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Select Deposits and tap on your Fixed Deposit Account. 3 Step 3 Select the Fixed Deposit that you wish to change maturity instructions for. 4 Step 4 Tap Change Maturity Instruction. 5 Step 5 Select your preferred Maturity Instruction and tap Next. For Withdraw Principal and Interest and Renew Principal and Withdraw Interest instructions, select the account for proceeds to be credited to. For foreign currency placements, you can choose to credit proceeds into your SGD or foreign currency wallet upon maturity. 6 Step 6 Review the details and tap Submit to complete the placement. Get the latest DBS digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Under Home, click on Deposits, and select your Fixed Deposit account. 4 Step 4 Click Manage, followed by Change to amend your Fixed Deposit maturity instructions. 5 Step 5 Select your preferred Maturity instructions and renewal period or account for funds to be credited into. faq_pairs.question: My Fixed Deposit account has 2 placements which sum up to S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal?
faq_pairs.answer: I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal.

sections.heading: Change Fixed Deposit Maturity Instructions
sections.content: Learn how you can change maturity instructions for your DBS Fixed Deposit Account via digibank.

sections.heading: Important information
sections.content: Change of maturity instructions will not be allowed on the day of maturity. The principal and interest will be renewed automatically based on the same tenor at the prevailing interest rate, unless you provide us with other instructions at least 1 working day before the maturity via digibank. SGD Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be computed based on the Total SGD Fixed Deposit Balances, instead of each placement and/or renewal. Examples My Fixed Deposit account has 2 placements which sum up to S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The total Fixed Deposit account balance is S$100,000 (S$30,000 + S$70,000). Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $100,000 - $249,999 range will apply. I have an existing placement of S$50,000 in my single name Fixed Deposit account and another S$50,000 in a joint Fixed Deposit account. What is the applicable interest rate for each renewal? The placements are in different SGD Fixed Deposit accounts. Hence, interest rate corresponding to the $50,000 - $99,999 range will apply for each renewal. Foreign Currency Fixed Deposit interest rates for new placements and renewals will be based on prevailing interest rates. Learn more on the Fixed Deposit placement rates. For earmarked Fixed Deposits, visit any DBS/POSB branch to update your maturity instructions.

title: Transfer Funds to Other Bank Accounts in Singapore
full_text: Transfer Funds to Other Bank Accounts in Singapore Learn how to send SGD or foreign currency to another DBS/POSB account or a different bank in Singapore. You can also schedule transfers to be sent out on a later date using digibank. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information The recipient's name you enter only serves as reference for you. The transfer is processed based on the account number you provided. Modes of local funds transfer in SGD There are various methods to transfer funds to other Bankâs account via digibank: FAST(Fast And Secure Transfers) PayNow FAST lets you send Singapore dollars almost instantly to other banks and financial institutions. Information Required Recipient's Name Recipient's Bank Name Recipient's Bank Account Number Fees: $0 Transfer Time: Almost Instant PayNow is an electronic fund transfer service that allows you to transfer SGD funds instantly to a payee, using the payee's designated mobile number or NRIC/FIN number instead of his/her bank account number. Learn more. Information Required Recipientâs designated mobile number; or Recipientâs NRIC/FIN number Fees: $0 Transfer Time: Almost Instant The transfer limit is up to S$200,000 daily. Learn more about how to change local funds transfer limits. If you are transferring funds to the following banks and non-financial institutions (NFIs), you can do so via Transfer to Other Bank Account (FAST) or PayNow. Other methods of transfers are not accepted by these banks and NFIs. List of Banks and NFIs GREEN LINK DIGITAL BANK PTE PTD GPAY NETWORK (S) PTE LTD LIQUID GROUP PTE LTD MATCHMOVE PAY PTE LTD NIUM PTE LTD SINGCASH PTE LTD WISE ASIA-PACIFIC PTE. LTD. XFERS PTE LTD Refer to the complete list of participating banks and non-bank financial institutions (NFIs) and account types for funds transfer (FAST). How to transfer SGD to other bank accounts in Singapore There are various channels which you may transfer funds to another bank account in Singapore with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on Pay & Transfer at the bottom, and select Local. 3 Step 3 Select your debiting account, recipient. Enter the amount you wish to transfer and select the Purpose of transfer. (You may learn how to Add Fund Transfer Recipient) 4 Step 4 If you wish to schedule a transfer in advance, select Later, the frequency of the transfer and indicate the date. Tap Next. 5 Step 5 Verify your transfer details and tap Transfer now to make the transfer. 6 Step 6 You've successfully submitted your fund transfer request. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Pay & Transfer on the left menu and under Services, click on Local transfer. 4 Step 4 Select your Account to transfer from, the recipient you wish to transfer to and enter the amount you wish to transfer. Select the Purpose of transfer and add Comments for the recipient if you wish to. (If the recipient is not in your recipients list, you may learn how to Add Fund Transfer Recipient) 5 Step 5 If you wish to schedule a transfer in advance, select Later or recurring, the frequency of the transfer and indicate the date. Click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify the details and click Transfer now to submit your transfer request. 7 Step 7 Your fund transfer request is completed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card DBS/POSB ATM (To other DBS/ POSB Account only) Insert your ATM/Debit Card and key in your PIN. Press Button for More Services. Press Button for Funds Transfer/Fixed Deposit. Select the Account Type to Debit. Select the Account Type to Credit. Select TO ANOTHER ACCOUNT. Indicate the Account Number you wish to transfer to. Enter the amount. Verify the Details of the Transaction and press Confirm. Find the nearest ATM using our Locator. How to transfer foreign currencies to other banks in Singapore You can transfer funds in foreign currencies to other banks in Singapore, using the Overseas transfer feature on digibank. Simply follow the steps below. digibank mobile To a new recipient To an existing recipient 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on Pay & Transfer at the bottom and select Overseas. 3 Step 3 Tap on a Add a recipient. 4 Step 4 Select or enter Singapore as the Location. 5 Step 5 Enter or search for your recipientâs bank SWIFT Code and enter your recipientâs Account number. 6 Step 6 Enter your recipient's Name, Address and tap Next. 7 Step 7 Verify your recipient's details and tap Add now. 8 Step 8 Tap on Transfer now. 9 Step 9 Select the debiting account you wish to transfer from and enter the Amount you wish to transfer. Select either You pay the fees or Recipient pays the fees. Tap Next. 10 Step 10 Review your transfer details and tap Transfer now to submit your transfer for processing. 11 Step 11 Your funds transfer request has been submitted for processing. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Tap on Pay & Transfer at the bottom and select Overseas. 3 Step 3 Select the Recipient you wish to make transfer to. 4 Step 4 Select the debiting account you wish to transfer from and enter the Amount you wish to transfer. Select either You pay the fees or Recipient pays the fees. Tap Next. 5 Step 5 Review your transfer details and tap Transfer now. 6 Step 6 Your funds transfer request has been submitted for processing. Get the latest digibank mobile app now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Pay and Transfer on the left menu and under Services, click on Overseas transfer. 4 Step 4 Select the Recipient you wish to make transfer to.(If the recipient is not in your recipients list, learn how to add overseas funds transfer recipient) 5 Step 5 Select your account you wish to transfer from and enter the Amount you wish to transfer. Select either You pay the fees or Recipient pays the fees. Click Next. 6 Step 6 Verify the transfer details and click Transfer now to submit your fund transfer request. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Want to send money to an overseas bank account? Transfer Funds to Overseas Account How to view or delete Scheduled Transfers There are various channels which you may manage your Scheduled Transfers with us. The most convenient method would be via digibank mobile. digibank mobile Log in to digibank mobile with your Touch / Face ID or digibank User ID & PIN. Tap Pay & Transfer on the bottom menu. Expand menu and tap on Scheduled. Select either One-time transfers or Recurring tab and tap on icon on the right of the fund transfer you wish to view. Your scheduled transfer details will be displayed. Tap on Cancel transfer if you wish to delete the scheduled transfer. Don't have digibank? Get the latest digibank mobile App now! digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Pay and Transfer on the left menu and under Services, click on Scheduled transfer. 4 Step 4 Select either One-time transfers or Recurring tab and click on icon on the right of the fund transfer you wish to view. 5 Step 5 Your scheduled transfer details will be displayed. Click on Cancel transfer if you wish to delete the scheduled transfer. 6 Step 6 Click Cancel now to confirm the deletion. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! title: Set up Standing Instruction for Local Funds Transfer
full_text: Set up Standing Instruction for Local Funds Transfer Need to transfer money on a regular basis to a designated account? Learn how you can set up a recurring local funds transfer via digibank online. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information A Standing Instruction service automatically transfers a fixed amount in SGD from your DBS/POSB Savings or Current Account to a designated local receiving account on a regular basis of your choice. A new Standing Instruction takes 3 working days to be in effect. POSB Kids-Trust Account is not available for standing instruction. How to set up Standing Instruction for local funds transfer digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Pay & Transfer on the left menu and under Services, click on Scheduled transfer. 4 Step 4 Click on Recurring at the top and select + Schedule a transfer. 5 Step 5 Select your Account to transfer from and the recipient you wish to schedule a transfer to. (If the your intended recipient is not in your recipients list, follow the steps to add a fund transfer recipient). 6 Step 6 Enter the Amount, select the Frequency and Start date of your recurring transfer. Toggle on Set an end date and select the End Date if youâd like the recurring transfer to have an expiry. Click Next. 7 Step 7 Verify your recurring transfer details and click Schedule now to complete the setup. 8 Step 8 You have set up a recurring fund transfer successfully. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information If the date of payment falls on a Saturday, Sunday or Public Holiday, the system will default it to the next working day (Monday to Friday) and subsequent payment dates remain unchanged. If the date of payment falls outside the calendar month (e.g. date of payment is on 29th and February having 28 calendar days), the system will deduct on the preceding working day (Monday to Friday). Subsequent payment dates remain unchanged. Setting up standing instructions to transfer funds is not accepted for the following banks and non-financial institutions (NFIs). To transfer funds to these banks and NFIs, please do so via one-time transfers via the 'Transfer to Other Bank Account (FAST)' option or via PayNow. GREEN LINK DIGITAL BANK PTE PTD GPAY NETWORK (S) PTE LTD LIQUID GROUP PTE LTD MATCHMOVE PAY PTE LTD NIUM PTE LTD SINGCASH PTE LTD WISE ASIA-PACIFIC PTE. LTD. XFERS PTE LTD DBS BANK LTD (To virtual accounts starting with 885) Was this information useful? Yes No We welcome your feedback Information is easy to understand and find Yes No Information is useful to answer your inquiries completely Yes No Thanks for your feedback! Weâll continue to work towards serving you better. title: View Standing Instruction for Local Funds Transfer
full_text: View Standing Instruction for Local Funds Transfer Find out how to view your existing recurring local funds transfer via digibank online. Part of: Guides > Your Guide to digibank Important information Viewing of your existing standing instructions is only available via digibank online and it is currently not available on digibank mobile. Please follow the guide below to view your existing standing instructions. How to view Standing Instruction for local funds transfer digibank online 1 Step 1 Log in to digibank online with your User ID & PIN. 2 Step 2 Complete the Authentication Process. 3 Step 3 Click Pay & Transfer on the left menu and under Services, click on Scheduled transfer. 4 Step 4 Under Recurring, click on the icon on the right of the scheduled transfer you wish to view. 5 Step 5 Your scheduled transfer details is displayed. Already a digibank user? Login now Forgot User ID or PIN Not yet a digibank user? Get Started For customers with ATM/Debit/Credit Card More information Only Standing Instructions for local funds transfer to another account will be shown. Standing Instructions using Cashier's Order, Demand Draft and Telegraphic Transfer (Overseas Funds Transfer) will not be shown on this page. Was this information useful?
